On a success, the creature takes half damage and is pushed 5 feet to a space of its choice. If that space is occupied, the creature is knocked prone.

Actions.Name: Burrow
Actions.Content: The bulette burrows under the ground without provoking opportunity attacks, moves up to its burrow speed, and then resurfaces in an unoccupied space. If it is within 5 feet of a creature, it then makes a bite attack.†

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d12 + 4) piercing damage.

Reactions.Name: Jaw Clamp (1/Day)
Reactions.Content: When an attacker within 5 feet of the bulette misses it with a melee attack, the bulette makes a bite attack against the attacker. On a hit, the attacker is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the grappled creature is restrained, and the only attack the bulette can make is a bite against the grappled creature.

Reactions.Name: Hard Carapace (1/Day)
Reactions.Content: After taking damage from an attack, the bulette lies down and closes its eyes, protecting all vulnerable spots. Until the beginning of its next turn, its AC becomes 21 and it has advantage on saving throws.

Traits.Name: Brave
Traits.Content: The bunyip has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

Traits.Name: Hold Breath
Traits.Content: The bunyip can hold its breath for 1 hour.

Traits.Name: Keen Hearing and Smell
Traits.Content: The bunyip has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing or smell.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The bunyip makes a bite attack and two slam attacks.†

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d12+6) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the bunyip can't bite another target.

Actions.Name: Slam
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10+6) bludgeoning damage.

BonusActions.Name: Terrifying Howl
BonusActions.Content: The bunyip unleashes a terrifying howl. Each creature of its choice within 120 feet that can see and hear it makes a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw, becoming frightened for 1 minute on a failure. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the bunyip's Terrifying Howl for the next 24 hours.†

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The cambion makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

Actions.Name: Black Iron Blade
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage, and the target takes a wound that deals 5 (1d10) ongoing slashing damage. A creature can end the ongoing damage by staunching the wound as an action or by giving the target magical healing.

Actions.Name: Fire Blast
Actions.Content: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d8) fire damage.

Actions.Name: Fiery Escape (1/Day)
Actions.Content: The cambion magically creates a fiery portal to the realm of its fiendish parent. The portal appears in an empty space within 5 feet. The portal lasts until the end of the cambion's next turn or until it passes through the portal. No one but the cambion can pass through the portal; anyone else that enters its space takes 14 (4d6) fire damage.

BonusActions.Name: Fell Charm
BonusActions.Content: The cambion targets one creature within 30 feet. The target makes a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it is magically charmed by the cambion for 1 day.† The effect ends if the cambion or a cambion's ally harms the target, or if the cambion commands it to take a suicidal action. While charmed, the target regards the cambion as a trusted friend and is an ally of the cambion. If the target makes a successful saving throw or the effect ends, the target is immune to this cambion's Fell Charm for 24 hours.†

BonusActions.Name: Command
BonusActions.Content: The cambion gives an order to an ally within 60 feet that can hear it. If the ally has a reaction available, it can use it to follow the cambion's order, either taking an action or moving up to its Speed.†

BonusActions.Name: Shapeshift
BonusActions.Content: The cambion magically changes its form to that of any humanoid creature it has seen before, or back into its true form. While shapeshifted, its statistics are unchanged except that it has no armor or equipment, can't use its black iron blade, and can fly only if it is in a form with wings. It reverts to its true form if it dies.†

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

Traits.Name: Keen Smell
Traits.Content: The cat has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

Traits.Name: Safe Landing
Traits.Content: The cat takes no falling damage from the first 10 feet that it falls.

Actions.Name: Claws
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage. If this damage would reduce a Small or larger target to 0 hit points, the target takes no damage from this attack.

Traits.Name: Keen Smell
Traits.Content: The bear has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The bear makes two melee attacks.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8+5) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Claws
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d4+5) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the bear can't attack a different target with its claws.

Traits.Name: Elite Recovery
Traits.Content: At the end of each of its turns while bloodied, the ogre can end one condition or effect on itself. It can do this even when unconscious or incapacitated.

Actions.Name: Greatclub
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it makes a DC 14 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure.†

Actions.Name: Sweeping Strike
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., all creatures within 5 feet. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it makes a DC 14 Strength saving throw. On a failure, it is pushed 10 feet away from the ogre.

Actions.Name: Javelin
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.
The cave ogre has the following additional action, which it can use only while bloodied:

Actions.Name: Rock
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it makes a DC 14 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure.

Reactions.Content: The ogre has the following reactions, which it can use only while bloodied:

Reactions.Name: Reflexive Swat
Reactions.Content: When a creature the ogre can see within 5 feet hits it with a melee attack, the ogre makes a greatclub attack against it.

Reactions.Name: Furious Smash (1/Day)
Reactions.Content: When it takes damage or is targeted by a spell, the cave ogre roars and smashes the ground, a tree, or another object, sending debris flying in a 30-foot radius around the ogre. Each creature in the area makes a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage on a failed save or half damage on a success. Until the debris is cleared, the area becomes difficult terrain, which the cave ogre ignores.

Traits.Name: Keen Smell
Traits.Content: The troll has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

Traits.Name: Regeneration
Traits.Content: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes radiant damage or is exposed to sunlight, this trait doesn't function on its next turn. The troll is petrified if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

Traits.Name: Severed Limbs
Traits.Content: If the troll is dealt a critical hit with a slashing weapon, one of its extremities is severed. The extremity has AC 15, 10 hit points, a Speed of 10, and the troll's Regeneration trait. The troll controls the severed extremity and perceives through it with the appropriate senses (for instance, it sees through the eyes of its severed head). As a bonus action, the troll can reattach the extremity. While the troll is missing the extremity, its maximum hit points are reduced by 10. Roll d6 to determine the severed extremity:

Traits.Name: 1-4: Arm
Traits.Content: If the troll has an arm, it loses an arm. It loses one of its claw attacks, and the severed arm can make a claw attack.

Traits.Name: 5-6: Head
Traits.Content: If the troll has a head, it loses its head. It loses its bite attack, and the severed head can make a bite attack.†

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The troll attacks with its bite and twice with its claw. When the troll uses Multiattack, it can make a rock attack in place of one claw attack.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Claw
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

Actions.Name: Rock
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The centaur attacks with its pike and its hooves.

Actions.Name: Pike
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Hooves
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If this attack deals damage, the centaur's movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from the target for the rest of the centaur's turn.

Actions.Name: Shortbow
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Deadeye Shot (1/Day)
Actions.Content: The centaur makes a shortbow attack with advantage.

Traits.Name: Devil's Sight
Traits.Content: The devil's darkvision penetrates magical darkness.

Traits.Name: Lawful Evil
Traits.Content: The devil radiates a Lawful and Evil aura.†

Traits.Name: Magic Resistance
Traits.Content: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

Traits.Name: Rattling Chains
Traits.Content: Whenever the devil moves, the rattling of its chains can be heard up to 300 feet away, unless it moves at half its Speed.

Traits.Name: Relentless Tracker
Traits.Content: Once the devil has grappled a creature in its chains, it has advantage on ability checks made to track that creature for the next 30 days.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The chain devil makes two chain attacks and commands up to two animated chains under its control to make chain attacks.

Actions.Name: Chain
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 16) and restrained. Until the grapple ends, this chain can only attack the grappled target.

BonusActions.Name: Animate Chain
BonusActions.Content: One inanimate, unattended chain within 60 feet sprouts blades and magically animates under the devil's control for 1 hour. It has AC 20 and 20 hit points, a Speed of 0, and immunity to psychic, piercing, poison, and thunder damage. When the devil uses Multiattack, the devil may command the chain to make one Chain attack against a target within 15 feet of it. If the chain is reduced to 0 hit points, it can't be reanimated.

Reactions.Name: Unnerving Mask
Reactions.Content: When damaged by a creature within 30 feet that can see the devil, the devil momentarily assumes the magical illusory form of one of the attacker's enemies or loved ones, alive or dead. The illusory figure may speak words that only the attacker can hear. The attacker makes a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage and is frightened until the end of its next turn.The attacker is then immune to this effect for the next 24 hours.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The warrior attacks twice.

Actions.Name: Greataxe
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) slashing damage. If the warrior has moved this turn, this attack is made with advantage.

Actions.Name: Champion warriors are the champions and chiefs who lead lightly-armed warriors on skirmishes and raids

Traits.Name: Reactive Heads
Traits.Content: The chimera can take three reactions per round, but not more than one per turn.

Traits.Name: Three Heads
Traits.Content: The chimera has advantage on Perception checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious, and it can't be flanked.

Traits.Name: Wakeful
Traits.Content: When one of the chimera's heads is asleep, the others are awake.

Actions.Name: Headbutt
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or fall prone.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Claw
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage, or 14 (4d4 + 4) slashing damage against a prone target.

Actions.Name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5ñ6)
Actions.Content: The dragon head breathes fire in a 15-foot cone. Creatures in the area make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

Reactions.Name: Tail Swipe (1/Day)
Reactions.Content: If a creature within 5 feet hits the chimera with a melee attack, the attacker is battered by the chimera's tail. The attacker makes a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure, it takes 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage and is pushed 10 feet from the chimera and knocked prone.†

Reactions.Name: Winged Charge (1/Day)
Reactions.Content: If a creature the chimera can see hits it with a ranged attack, the chimera leaps off the ground and moves up to its fly speed towards the attacker. If within range, the chimera then makes a headbutt attack against the attacker.

LegendaryActions.Name: The chimera can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below
LegendaryActions.Content: Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. It regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

LegendaryActions.Name: Bite
LegendaryActions.Content: The chimera uses its Bite attack.

LegendaryActions.Name: Claw
LegendaryActions.Content: The chimera uses its Claw attack.

Name: Chuul
Languages: Understands Deep Speech But Canít Speak

Traits.Name: Amphibious
Traits.Content: The chuul can breathe air and water.

Traits.Name: Detect Magic
Traits.Content: The chuul senses a magical aura around any visible creature or object within 120 feet that bears magic.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: If the chuul is grappling a creature, it uses its tentacle on that creature. It then makes two pincer attacks.

Actions.Name: Pincer
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). When carrying a grappled creature, the chuul can move at full speed.† A pincer that is being used to grapple a creature can be used only to attack that creature.

Actions.Name: Tentacle
Actions.Content: A grappled creature makes a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is paralyzed for 1 minute. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the paralysis on a success.†

Name: Clay Guardian
Languages: Understands The Languages Of Its Creator But Canít Speak

Traits.Name: Constructed Nature
Traits.Content: Guardians don't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The guardian attacks twice with its slam.

Actions.Name: Slam
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage dealt. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0. A greater restoration spell or similar magic removes the reduction.

Traits.Name: False Appearance
Traits.Content: When motionless, the cloaker is indistinguishable from a black cloak or similar cloth or leather article.

Traits.Name: Light Sensitivity
Traits.Content: The cloaker has disadvantage on attack rolls and Perception checks while in bright light.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). If the cloaker has advantage against the target, the cloaker attaches to the target's head, and the target is blinded and suffocating. Until this grapple ends, the cloaker automatically hits the grappled creature with this attack. When the cloaker is dealt damage while grappling, it takes half the damage (rounded down) and the other half is dealt to the grappled target. The cloaker can have only one creature grappled at once.

Actions.Name: Tail
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage, and the creature makes a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is poisoned until the end of the cloaker's next turn.

Actions.Name: Moan
Actions.Content: Each non-aberration creature within 60 feet that can hear its moan makes a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it is frightened until the end of the cloaker's next turn. When a creature succeeds on this saving throw, it becomes immune to the cloaker's moan for 24 hours.

Actions.Name: Phantasms (1/Day)
Actions.Content: The cloaker magically creates flickering illusions of itself in its space. Attacks on it have disadvantage. This effect ends after 1 minute, when the cloaker enters an area of bright light, or when it successfully grapples a creature.

Reactions.Name: Reactive Tail
Reactions.Content: When hit or missed with a melee attack, the cloaker makes a tail attack against the attacker.

Reactions.Name: Angry Moan
Reactions.Content: When the cloaker takes damage, it uses Moan.

Traits.Name: False Appearance
Traits.Content: While motionless, the sentinel is indistinguishable from normal armor.

Traits.Name: Clockwork Nature
Traits.Content: A clockwork doesn't require air, nourishment, or rest, and is immune to disease.

Traits.Name: Immutable Form
Traits.Content: The clockwork is immune to any effect that would alter its form.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The sentinel attacks three times.

Actions.Name: Halberd
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

Actions.Name: Calculated Sweep
Actions.Content: The sentinel makes a melee attack against each creature of its choice within 10 feet. On a critical hit, the target makes a DC 13 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure.

BonusActions.Name: Overclock (Recharge 5ñ6)
BonusActions.Content: The sentinel takes the Dash action.

Reactions.Name: Parry
Reactions.Content: The sentinel adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it.

Traits.Name: Cloud Sight
Traits.Content: Clouds and fog do not impair the giant's vision.

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The giant's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light
3/day each: feather fall, fly, misty step, telekinesis
1/day each: control weather, gaseous form

Traits.Name: Keen Smell
Traits.Content: The giant has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The giant attacks twice with its glaive.

Actions.Name: Glaive
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it makes a DC 20 Strength saving throw. On a failure, it is pushed up to 10 feet away from the giant and knocked prone.

Actions.Name: Rock
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 39 (9d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it makes a DC 20 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure.†

Actions.Name: Fog Cloud (1st-Level; V, S, Concentration)
Actions.Content: The giant creates a 20-foot-radius, heavily obscured sphere of fog centered on a point it can see within 120 feet. The fog spreads around corners and can be dispersed by a moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour). It lasts for 1 hour.

BonusActions.Name: Gust
BonusActions.Content: One creature within 10 feet makes a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure, it is pushed up to 30 feet away from the giant.

BonusActions.Name: Misty Step (2nd-Level; V)
BonusActions.Content: The giant teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet. The giant can't cast this spell and a 1st-level or higher spell on the same turn.

Traits.Name: Cloud Sight
Traits.Content: Clouds and fog do not impair the giant's vision.

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The giant's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light
3/day each: feather fall, fly, misty step, telekinesis
1/day each: control weather, gaseous form

Traits.Name: Keen Smell
Traits.Content: The giant has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The giant attacks twice with its glaive.

Actions.Name: Glaive
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it makes a DC 20 Strength saving throw. On a failure, it is pushed up to 10 feet away from the giant and knocked prone.

Actions.Name: Rock
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 39 (9d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it makes a DC 20 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure.†

Actions.Name: Fog Cloud (1st-Level; V, S, Concentration)
Actions.Content: The giant creates a 20-foot-radius, heavily obscured sphere of fog centered on a point it can see within 120 feet. The fog spreads around corners and can be dispersed by a moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour). It lasts for 1 hour.

Actions.Name: Arc Lightning (1/Day)
Actions.Content: Up to three creatures within 60 feet that the giant can see make DC 15 Dexterity saving throws, taking 42 (12d6) lightning damage on a failure or half damage on a success.

Actions.Name: Blinking Blades (1/Day)
Actions.Content: The giant magically teleports multiple times within a few seconds. The giant may make one glaive attack against each creature of its choice within 30 feet, up to a maximum of 6 attacks.†

Actions.Name: Reverse Gravity (1/Day)
Actions.Content: Each creature of the giant's choice within 30 feet is magically hurled 60 feet in the air. If a creature hits an obstacle, it takes 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage. The creatures then fall, taking falling damage as normal.

Actions.Name: Silver Tongue (1/Day)
Actions.Content: One creature that can hear the giant within 30 feet makes a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it is magically charmed by the giant for 1 hour. This effect ends if the giant or its allies harm the creature.

BonusActions.Name: Gust
BonusActions.Content: One creature within 10 feet makes a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure, it is pushed up to 30 feet away from the giant.

BonusActions.Name: Misty Step (2nd-Level; V)
BonusActions.Content: The giant teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet. The giant can't cast this spell and a 1st-level or higher spell on the same turn.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target makes a DC 11 Constitution saving throw against being petrified. On a failure, the target is restrained as it begins to turn to stone. A lesser restoration spell ends this effect. If still restrained, the creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified for 24 hours.

Reactions.Name: Frenzy (1/Day)
Reactions.Content: When attacked by a creature it can see within 20 feet, the cockatrice moves up to half its Speed and makes a bite attack against that creature.

Actions.Name: Club
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

Actions.Name: Stone
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 10/30 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

Actions.Name: Commoners are humanoids who are not trained in combat
Actions.Content: Typical commoners include farmers, herders, artisans, servants, and scholars.

Traits.Name: Area Vulnerability
Traits.Content: The mob takes double damage from any effect that targets an area.

Traits.Name: Mob Dispersal
Traits.Content: When the mob is reduced to 0 hit points, it turns into 5 (1d6 + 2) commoners with 2 hit points.

Traits.Name: Mob
Traits.Content: The mob is composed of 10 or more commoners. If it is subjected to a spell, attack, or other effect that affects only one target, it takes any damage but ignores other effects. It can share its space with Medium or smaller creatures or objects. The mob can move through any opening large enough for one Medium creature.

Actions.Name: Clubs
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., up to two targets. Hit: 10 (4d4) bludgeoning damage, or half damage if the mob is bloodied.

Actions.Name: Stones
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 10/30 ft., up to two targets. Hit: 10 (4d4) bludgeoning damage, or half damage if the mob is bloodied.

Actions.Name: When riled up by strident voices, angry people may coalesce into a group that acts like a single organism
Actions.Content: A mob might commit acts of violence its individual members would otherwise shun.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Constrict
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) bludgeoning damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and the snake can't constrict a different target.

Traits.Name: Flow Within the Mountain
Traits.Content: The dragon has advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in mountainous regions.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d10 + 2) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5ñ6)
Actions.Content: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:

Actions.Name: Acid Breath
Actions.Content: The dragon exhales acid in a 20-foot-long, 5-foot wide-line. Each creature in the area makes a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 (3d8) acid damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

Actions.Name: Slowing Breath
Actions.Content: The dragon exhales toxic gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area makes a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, becoming slowed for 1 minute on a failure. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Traits.Name: Aquatic
Traits.Content: The coralfish can only breathe underwater.†

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target makes a DC 11 Constitution saving throw against being petrified. On a failure, the target is restrained as it begins to turn to a brightly colored statue. A lesser restoration spell ends this effect. If still restrained, the creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified for 24 hours.

Reactions.Name: Frenzy (1/Day)
Reactions.Content: When attacked by a creature it can see within 20 feet, the cockatrice moves up to half its Speed and makes a bite attack against that creature.

Traits.Name: Magic Resistance
Traits.Content: The unicorn has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The unicorn attacks once with its hooves and once with its horn.

Actions.Name: Hooves
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

Actions.Name: Horn
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) radiant damage. If the target is a creature and the unicorn moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage and makes a DC 16 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure.

Actions.Name: Trample
Actions.Content: The unicorn attacks a prone creature with its hooves.

Actions.Name: Darkness Aura (1/Day)
Actions.Content: A 15-foot radius area of magical darkness emanates from the unicorn, spreading around corners and moving with it. Darkvision and natural light can't penetrate it. If the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a 2nd-level spell or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled. The darkness aura lasts for 10 minutes or until the unicorn takes damage. The aura doesn't hinder the unicorn's sight.

Actions.Name: Grant Boon (3/Day)
Actions.Content: The unicorn touches a willing creature, including itself, with its horn and grants one of the following boons:

Actions.Name: Healing: The creature magically regains 21 (6d6) hit points
Actions.Content: It is cured of all diseases, and poisons affecting it are neutralized.

Actions.Name: Luck: During the next 24 hours, the creature can roll a d12 and add the result to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw after seeing the result
Protection: A glowing mote of light orbits the creature's head
Actions.Content: The mote lasts 24 hours. When the creature fails a saving throw, it can use its reaction to expend the mote and succeed on the saving throw.

Actions.Name: Resolution: The creature is immune to being charmed or frightened for 24 hours

Traits.Name: Alchemy Schooling
Traits.Content: The alchemist gains their proficiency bonus and an expertise die (+1d6) on checks made with alchemist's supplies.

Traits.Name: Crafting
Traits.Content: So long as the alchemist has the required components and equipment, they are able to craft potions of up to legendary rarity and other magic items of up to very rare rarity.

Traits.Name: Potion Crafter
Traits.Content: The alchemist has the following potions on hand:

Traits.Name: Potion of climbing: For 1 hour, the drinker gains a climb speed equal to its Speed and has advantage on Athletics checks made to climb
Potion of greater healing (3): Restores 14 (4d4 + 4) hit points
Potion of superior healing: Restores 28 (8d4 + 8) hit points
Potion of water breathing: For 1 hour, the drinker can breathe underwater

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The alchemist attacks twice with their dagger.

Actions.Name: Dagger
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

Actions.Name: Bomb (3/Day)
Actions.Content: The alchemist lobs a bomb at a point they can see within 80 feet. Upon impact, the bomb explodes in a 10-foot radius. Creatures in the area make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) fire damage on a failure or half damage on a success.†

BonusActions.Name: Alter Bomb
BonusActions.Content: The alchemist quickly swaps reagents to change the damage dealt by their next bomb to acid, cold, lightning, poison, or thunder.

BonusActions.Name: Potion
BonusActions.Content: The alchemist drinks or administers a potion.

Reactions.Name: Desperate Drink (1/Day, While Bloodied)
Reactions.Content: When the alchemist is dealt damage, they drink a potion.

Reactions.Name: In the biggest cities, there are potion brewers as superbly skilled as they are suspicious and skeptical, keen to the thieving hands of adventurers and other ne'er-do-wells
A typical cosmopolitan alchemist employs a trusted underling, such as a hired veteran or hound guardian, for protection

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The couatl's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect evil and good, detect magic
3/day each: create food and water, detect thoughts, lesser restoration
1/day each: dream, greater restoration, scrying

Traits.Name: Lawful Good
Traits.Content: The couatl radiates a Lawful and Good aura.

Traits.Name: Nondetection
Traits.Content: The couatl can't be targeted or perceived by divination magic.†

Actions.Name: Constrict
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the couatl can't constrict other targets, and the couatl has advantage on attacks against the target.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target makes a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is poisoned for 24 hours. The target is unconscious until the poisoned condition ends or a creature uses an action to shake the target awake.

Actions.Name: Heal (1/Day)
Actions.Content: The couatl touches a creature, magically healing 20 hit points of damage and ending the poisoned condition on that creature.†

Actions.Name: Shapeshift
Actions.Content: The couatl magically changes its form to resemble that of a humanoid or beast, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. If its form is humanoid, it is equipped with clothing and a weapon. While shapeshifted, its statistics are the same except that it can't use Constrict and Shielding Wing and it may gain a swim speed of 60 or lose its fly speed if appropriate to its new form. If it's a beast, it can use its bite attack. If it's a humanoid, it may make a weapon attack, which functions identically to its bite attack.

Reactions.Name: Shielding Wing
Reactions.Content: When the couatl or a creature within 5 feet is attacked, the couatl can interpose a wing and impose disadvantage on the attack.

Traits.Name: Amphibious
Traits.Content: The hag can breathe air and water.

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights, disguise self, invisibility, minor illusion
1/day: geas

Traits.Name: Mimicry
Traits.Content: The hag can mimic voices and animal sounds. Recognizing the sounds as imitation requires a DC 13 Insight check.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The hag attacks twice with its claws and then uses Hex if not in beast form.

Actions.Name: Beast Form
Actions.Content: The hag magically transforms into a Large or smaller beast or back into its true form. While in beast form, it retains its game statistics, can't cast spells, can't use Hex, and can't speak. The hag's Speed increases by 10 feet, and when appropriate to its beast form it gains a climb, fly, or swim speed of 40 feet. Any equipment the hag is wearing or wielding merges into its new form.†

Actions.Name: Claws
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

Actions.Name: Hex (Gaze)
Actions.Content: A creature within 60 feet that is not already under a hag's hex makes a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. A creature under an obligation to the hag automatically fails this saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target is cursed with a magical hex that lasts 30 days. The curse ends early if the target suffers harm from the hag or if the hag ends it as an action. Roll 1d4:
Charm Hex. The target is charmed by the hag.†
Fear Hex. The target is frightened of the hag.†
Ill Fortune Hex. The hag magically divines the target's activities. Whenever the target attempts a long-duration task such as a craft or downtime activity, the hag can cause the activity to fail.†
Sleep Hex. The target falls unconscious. The curse ends early if the target takes damage or if a creature uses an action to shake it awake.

Actions.Name: Invisibility (2nd-Level; V, S, Concentration)
Actions.Content: The hag is invisible for 1 hour. The spell ends if the hag attacks, uses Hex, or casts a spell.

Traits.Name: Curse
Traits.Content: A creature touched by the hag's claws is magically cursed for 30 days. While under this curse, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls made against the hag.

Traits.Name: Evil
Traits.Content: The hag radiates an Evil aura.†

Traits.Name: Magic Resistance
Traits.Content: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

Actions.Name: Claws
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage, and the target is subject to the hag's Curse trait.

Actions.Name: Sleep Touch
Actions.Content: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: The target falls asleep for 4 hours or until it takes damage or is shaken awake. Once the hag successfully hits a target, it can't make this attack again until it finishes a long rest.

Actions.Name: Shapeshift
Actions.Content: The hag magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid. Equipment it is carrying isn't transformed. It retains its claws in any form. It has no true form and remains in its current form when it dies.

Actions.Name: Planar Travel (3/Day)
Actions.Content: The hag magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. Alternatively, the hag is magically transported to the Material Plane, Hell, or the Abyss, arriving within 10 miles of its desired destination.

Actions.Name: Nightmare Haunting (1/Day)
Actions.Content: While on the Ethereal Plane, the hag magically touches a sleeping creature that is under the night hag's Curse and is not protected by a magic circle or protection from evil and good spell or similar magic. As long as the touch persists, the target has terrible nightmares. If the nightmares last for 1 hour, the target gains no benefit from the rest, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 5 (1d10) until the curse ends. If this effect reduces the target's hit points maximum to 0, the target dies and the hag captures its soul. The reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until removed by greater restoration or similar magic.

BonusActions.Name: Fragmentary Dream
BonusActions.Content: The hag creates a terrifying illusion visible only to one creature that it can see within 120 feet. The creature makes a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. It takes 22 (4d10) psychic damage and becomes frightened until the end of its turn on a failure, or takes half damage on a success.

Reactions.Name: Steal Magic (3/Day)
Reactions.Content: When a creature the hag can see within 60 feet casts a spell using a 3rd-level or lower spell slot, the hag attempts to steal its power. The caster makes a DC 14 saving throw using its spellcasting ability. On a failure, the spell fails, and the hag gains 5 (1d10) temporary hit points per level of the spell slot used.

Traits.Name: Amphibious
Traits.Content: The hag can breathe air and water.

Traits.Name: Curse
Traits.Content: A creature that makes a bargain with the hag is magically cursed for 30 days. While it is cursed, the target automatically fails saving throws against the hag's scrying and geas spells, and the hag can cast control weather centered on the creature.

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights, disguise self
1/day: control weather, geas, scrying

Actions.Name: Claws
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

Actions.Name: Death Glare (Gaze)
Actions.Content: One frightened creature within 30 feet makes a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature drops to 0 hit points. On a success, the creature takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The hag attacks twice with its claws.

Actions.Name: Lightning Blast (Recharge 5-6)
Actions.Content: An 80-foot-long, 5-foot-wide lightning bolt springs from the hag's extended claw. Each creature in the area makes a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) lightning damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.†

BonusActions.Name: Horrific Transformation
BonusActions.Content: The hag briefly takes on a terrifying form or reveals its true form. Each creature within 30 feet that can see the hag makes a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. A creature under the hag's curse automatically fails this saving throw. On a failure, the creature is frightened until the end of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, it is immune to the hag's Horrific Transformation for 24 hours.

Traits.Name: Curse
Traits.Content: A creature that accepts a gift from the hag is magically cursed for 30 days. While it is cursed, the target automatically fails saving throws against the hag's charm person, geas, and scrying spells, and the hag can cast control weather centered on the creature.

Traits.Name: Icy Travel
Traits.Content: The hag is not hindered by cold weather, icy surfaces, snow, wind, or storms. Additionally, the hag and her allies leave no trace when walking on snow or ice.

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: charm person, dancing lights, invisibility, minor illusion, passwall (ice only)
1/day: control weather (extreme cold), geas, scrying
1/day each: cone of cold, wall of ice

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The hag attacks with its claws and uses Ice Bolt.

Actions.Name: Claws
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

Actions.Name: Ice Bolt
Actions.Content: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) cold damage, and the target makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. A creature under the hag's curse automatically fails this saving throw. On a failure, the creature is restrained as it begins to turn to ice. At the end of the creature's next turn, the creature repeats the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified into ice. This petrification can be removed with greater restoration or similar magic.†

Actions.Name: Shapeshift
Actions.Content: The hag magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Equipment it is carrying isn't transformed. It retains a streak of white hair in any form. It returns to its true form if it dies.

Actions.Name: Invisibility (2nd-Level; V, S, Concentration)
Actions.Content: The hag is invisible for 1 hour. The spell ends if the hag attacks or casts a spell.

Actions.Name: Cone of Cold (5th-Level; V, S)
Actions.Content: Frost blasts from the hag in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in the area makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) cold damage on a failure or half damage on a success.†

Actions.Name: Wall of Ice (6th-level; V, S, Concentration)
Actions.Content: The hag magically creates a wall of ice on a solid surface it can see within 120 feet. The wall is flat, 1 foot thick, and can be up to 50 feet long and 20 feet high. The wall lasts for 10 minutes. Each 10-foot section has AC 12, 30 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to cold, poison, and psychic damage. Destroying a 10-foot section of wall leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the section occupied. A creature moving through the sheet of frigid air for the first time on a turn makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) cold damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

Actions.Name: If the wall enters a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (hag's choice)
Actions.Content: The creature then makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) cold damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

Reactions.Name: Ice Shield
Reactions.Content: The hag adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it made by a creature it can see. If the attack misses, the attacker takes 14 (4d6) cold damage.

Traits.Name: Amphibious
Traits.Content: The crab can breathe air and water.

Actions.Name: Claws
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 bludgeoning damage. If this damage would reduce a Small or larger target to 0 hit points, the target takes no damage from this attack.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The boss attacks three times with their shortsword.

Actions.Name: Shortsword
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Dagger
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Mark for Death
Actions.Content: The boss targets a creature within 30 feet that can see or hear them. For 1 minute or until the boss threatens a different target, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage whenever the boss hits it with a weapon attack.

Reactions.Name: Command Bodyguard
Reactions.Content: When the boss would be hit by an attack, they command an ally within 5 feet to use its reaction to switch places with the boss. The ally is hit by the attack instead of the boss.

Reactions.Name: Offhand Dagger
Reactions.Content: When missed by an attack, the boss makes a dagger attack.

Reactions.Name: A crime boss has risen to the top of a criminal gang or guild
Reactions.Content: They're tough in a fight but too smart to do their own dirty work unless absolutely necessary.

Traits.Name: Hold Breath
Traits.Content: The crocodile can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10+2) piercing damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and the crocodile can't bite a different target.

Traits.Name: Clockwork Nature
Traits.Content: A clockwork doesn't require air, nourishment, or rest, and is immune to disease.

Traits.Name: Immutable Form
Traits.Content: The clockwork is immune to any effect that would alter its form.

Actions.Name: Crush
Actions.Content: The crusher moves up to its Speed in a straight line. While doing so, it can attempt to enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the crusher attempts to enter a creature's space, the creature makes a DC 17 Dexterity or Strength saving throw (the creature's choice). If the creature succeeds at a Strength saving throw, the crusher's movement ends for the turn. If the creature succeeds at a Dexterity saving throw, the creature may use its reaction, if available, to move up to half its Speed without provoking opportunity attacks. The first time on the crusher's turn that it enters a creature's space, the creature is knocked prone and takes 50 (10d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. A creature is prone while in the crusher's space.

Actions.Name: Ram
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the crusher moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack, the attack deals an extra 18 (4d8) bludgeoning damage.

BonusActions.Name: Overclock (Recharge 5ñ6)
BonusActions.Content: The crusher takes the Dash action.

Traits.Name: Fanatic
Traits.Content: The cult fanatic has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

Traits.Name: Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The cult fanatic is a 4th level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). They have the following cleric spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
1st-level (4 slots): ceremony, command, detect evil and good, inflict wounds
2nd-level (3 slots): blindness/deafness, hold person

Actions.Name: Dagger
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Sacred Flame (Cantrip; V, S)
Actions.Content: One creature the cult fanatic can see within 60 feet makes a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) radiant damage on a failure. This spell ignores cover.

Actions.Name: Command (1st-Level; V)
Actions.Content: One non-undead creature the cult fanatic can see within 60 feet that can hear and understand them makes a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target uses its next turn to grovel (falling prone and then ending its turn).

Actions.Name: Inflict Wounds (1st-Level; V, S)
Actions.Content: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

Actions.Name: Blindness/Deafness (2nd-Level; V)
Actions.Content: One creature the cult fanatic can see within 30 feet makes a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is blinded or deafened (cult fanatic's choice) for 1 minute.† The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.†

Actions.Name: Hold Person (2nd-Level; V, S, M, Concentration)
Actions.Content: One humanoid the cult fanatic can see within 60 feet makes a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is paralyzed for 1 minute. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.†

Actions.Name: Cult fanatics are leaders who recruit for and command forbidden cults
Actions.Content: They have either been granted real spellcasting abilities by the dark forces they serve, or they have twisted their pre-existing magical abilities to the service of their cause.

Traits.Name: Fanatic
Traits.Content: The cultist has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened by creatures not in their cult.

Actions.Name: Dagger
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Cultists worship forbidden gods, devils, demons, and other sinister beings
Actions.Content: Many cultists work to summon the object of their devotion to the world so it might grant them power and destroy their enemies.

Traits.Name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
Traits.Content: The cutthroat deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when they hit with a weapon attack while they have advantage on the attack, or when the cutthroat's target is within 5 feet of an ally of the cutthroat while the cutthroat doesn't have disadvantage on the attack.

Actions.Name: Shortsword
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Hand Crossbow
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

BonusActions.Name: Cunning Action
BonusActions.Content: The cutthroat takes the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

BonusActions.Name: Rapid Attack
BonusActions.Content: The cutthroat attacks with their shortsword.

BonusActions.Name: Cutthroats range from back-alley murderers to guild thieves to dungeon delvers
BonusActions.Content: They prefer a surprise attack to a frontal assault.

Traits.Name: Panicked Rage
Traits.Content: While a cyclops is frightened and the source of its fear is in sight, it makes attack rolls with advantage instead of disadvantage.

Traits.Name: Poor Depth Perception
Traits.Content: The cyclops makes all ranged attacks with disadvantage.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The cyclops makes two melee attacks.

Actions.Name: Club
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

Actions.Name: Rock
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 120 ft. (see Poor Depth Perception), one target. Hit: 32 (5d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

BonusActions.Name: Thick Skulled (1/Day)
BonusActions.Content: The cyclops can end one condition on itself that was imposed through a failed Wisdom saving throw.

Reactions.Name: Big Windup
Reactions.Content: When a creature hits the cyclops with a melee attack, the cyclops readies a powerful strike against its attacker. The cyclops has advantage on the next club attack it makes against the attacker before the end of its next turn.

Traits.Name: Panicked Rage
Traits.Content: While a cyclops is frightened and the source of its fear is in sight, it makes attack rolls with advantage instead of disadvantage.

Traits.Name: Poor Depth Perception
Traits.Content: The cyclops makes all ranged attacks with disadvantage.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The cyclops makes two melee attacks.

Actions.Name: Maul
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (6d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

Actions.Name: Rock
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 120 ft. (see Poor Depth Perception), one target. Hit: 32 (5d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

BonusActions.Name: Thick Skulled (1/Day)
BonusActions.Content: The cyclops can end one condition on itself that was imposed through a failed Wisdom saving throw.

Reactions.Name: Big Windup
Reactions.Content: When a creature hits the cyclops with a melee attack, the cyclops readies a powerful strike against its attacker. The cyclops has advantage on the next club attack it makes against the attacker before the end of its next turn.

Traits.Name: Echolocation
Traits.Content: The darkmantle can't use blindsight while deafened.

Traits.Name: False Appearance
Traits.Content: While motionless, the darkmantle is indistinguishable from rock.††

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The darkmantle uses Darkness Aura and makes a crush attack.

Actions.Name: Darkness Aura
Actions.Content: A 15-foot radius area of magical darkness emanates from the darkmantle, spreading around corners and moving with it. Darkvision and natural light can't penetrate it. If the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a 2nd-level spell or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled. The darkness aura lasts for 10 minutes or until the darkmantle takes damage.

Actions.Name: Crush
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13). If the darkmantle made the attack with advantage, it attaches to the target's head, and the target is blinded and can't breathe. While grappling, the darkmantle can only attack the grappled creature but has advantage on its attack roll. The darkmantle's speed becomes 0, and it moves with its target.

Traits.Name: Ethereal and Material
Traits.Content: The dead man's fingers lives simultaneously on the Ethereal and Material Planes. Its senses extend into both planes, and it can touch and be touched by creatures on both planes.†

Traits.Name: Ethereal Shift
Traits.Content: When a creature on the Material Plane touches the dead man's fingers or hits it with a melee attack, the creature is magically transported to the Ethereal Plane. The creature can see and hear into both the Ethereal and Material Plane but is unaffected by creatures and objects on the Material Plane. It can be seen as a ghostly form by creatures on the Material Plane. It can move in any direction, with each foot of movement up or down costing 2 feet of movement.

Traits.Name: If the creature is still on the Ethereal Plane when the dead man's fingers dies, the creature returns to the Material Plane
Traits.Content: If this would cause a creature to appear in a space occupied by a solid object or creature, it is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and takes 10 (3d6) force damage.

Traits.Name: Flammable
Traits.Content: After taking fire damage, the dead man's fingers catches fire and takes ongoing 11 (2d10) fire damage if it isn't already suffering ongoing fire damage. It can spend an action or bonus action to extinguish this fire.†

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The dead man's fingers makes two tendril attacks.

Actions.Name: Tendril (Ethereal or Material Plane)
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage. A target on the Material Plane is subject to the Ethereal Shift trait.

Actions.Name: Ethereal Spores (While Bloodied, Ethereal Plane Only)
Actions.Content: Each creature within 30 feet makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 (9d6) necrotic damage on a failed save or half damage on a success. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this damage dies. If a creature killed by this attack remains on the Ethereal Plane for 24 hours, its corpse disintegrates, and a new dead man's fingers sprouts from its place.

BonusActions.Name: Telekinetic Pull (Ethereal or Material Plane)
BonusActions.Content: One creature within 90 feet makes a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure, it is magically pulled up to 60 feet straight towards the dead man's fingers.

Traits.Name: Two Heads
Traits.Content: The death dog has advantage on Perception checks and on saving throws made to resist being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious, and it can't be flanked.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The death dog attacks twice with its bite.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it makes a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it becomes infected with a disease. Until this disease is cured, the target is poisoned. While diseased, the target makes a DC 12 Constitution saving throw every 24 hours, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure and ending the disease on a success. This hit point maximum reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

Traits.Name: Deep Dwarf Resistance
Traits.Content: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against illusions and to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

Traits.Name: Deep Dwarf Magic
Traits.Content: The deep dwarf can innately cast enlarge/reduce (self only, enlarge only) and invisibility (self only) once per long rest without using material components, using Intelligence for their spellcasting ability.

Actions.Name: War Pick
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, or 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage if within 5 feet of an ally that is not incapacitated, plus 2 (1d4) damage when Enlarged.

Actions.Name: Enlarge (2nd-Level; V, S, Concentration)
Actions.Content: The soldier and their equipment grow to Large size for 1 minute. They have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and their attacks deal an extra 2 (1d4) damage (included in their War Pick attack).

Actions.Name: Invisibility (2nd-Level; V, S, Concentration)
Actions.Content: The soldier is invisible for 1 hour. The spell ends if the soldier attacks or casts a spell.

Actions.Name: Heavy Crossbow
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage.

BonusActions.Name: Tactical Movement
BonusActions.Content: Until the end of the soldier's turn, their Speed is halved and their movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

BonusActions.Name: Deep dwarves march grimly to battle from huge underground cities, fighting and dying in wars that never reach the surface, even in rumor

Traits.Name: Keen Hearing and Sight
Traits.Content: The scout has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing or sight.

Traits.Name: Camouflage
Traits.Content: The scout has advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

Traits.Name: Deep Gnome Resistance
Traits.Content: The scout has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

Traits.Name: Deep Gnome Magic
Traits.Content: The deep gnome can innately cast blindness/deafness (blindness only), disguise self, and nondetection once per long rest without using material components, using Intelligence for their spellcasting ability.

Actions.Name: War Pick
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Blindness (2nd-Level; V)
Actions.Content: A creature within 30 feet makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is blinded for 1 minute. It repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Actions.Name: Far underground, deep gnomes use stealth to survive amidst warlike deep dwarves and imperious shadow elves
Actions.Content: Deep gnome scouts hunt and forage, search for gems, and set ambushes for enemies who approach their settlements.

Traits.Name: Keen Smell
Traits.Content: The deer has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Headbutt
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

Name: Demilich
Languages: Understands The Languages It Knew In Life But Doesnít Speak

Traits.Name: Avoidance
Traits.Content: If the demilich makes a saving throw against an effect that deals half damage on a success, it takes no damage on a success and half damage on a failure.

Traits.Name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
Traits.Content: If the demilich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, one of the five tiny warding gems set on its forehead or teeth shatters.

Traits.Name: Undead Nature
Traits.Content: A demilich doesn't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

Actions.Name: Devour Soul
Actions.Content: The demilich targets one creature within 120 feet, forcing it to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a success, or if all the large soul gems on the demilich's skull are occupied, the creature takes 40 necrotic damage, and the demilich regains the same number of hit points. If the target fails its saving throw and there is at least one unoccupied soul gem on the demilich's skull, the demilich regains 40 hit points, and the target dies instantly. Its soul is trapped in a soul gem on the demilich's skull, visible as a tiny, creature-shaped mote of light. While its soul is trapped, a creature can't be restored to life by any means. A soul that remains in a soul gem for 30 days is destroyed forever. If the demilich is defeated and a soul gem crushed, the creature is restored to life if its body is within 100 miles. A creature that succeeds on a saving throw against this effect is immune to it for 24 hours.

Actions.Name: A demilich begins combat with one or two empty soul gems

LegendaryActions.Name: The demilich can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below
LegendaryActions.Content: Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The demilich regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

LegendaryActions.Name: Cranial Transposition
LegendaryActions.Content: The dust surrounding the demilich falls to the ground. The demilich and a nonmagical, unattended skull within 30 teleport, switching places. Until the demilich moves or attacks, it is indistinguishable from a nonmagical skull, and the dust composing the demilich's wraithlike body doesn't reform around it.

LegendaryActions.Name: Dust Storm (Costs 2 Actions)
LegendaryActions.Content: The dust of the demilich's body swirls in a 30-foot radius around the demilich. Each creature in the area makes a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 21 (6d6) necrotic damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. The demilich then moves up to its speed.

LegendaryActions.Name: Ringing Laugh (Costs 2 Actions)
LegendaryActions.Content: Each creature within 60 feet that can hear the demilich makes a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature is frightened until the end of its next turn.

LegendaryActions.Name: Telekinesis
LegendaryActions.Content: The demilich targets a Huge or smaller creature or an object weighing up to 1,000 pounds within 60 feet. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw. Otherwise, the demilich moves the target up to 30 feet in any direction, including up. If another creature or object stops the target's movement, both take 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage. At the end of this movement, the target falls if it is still in the air, taking falling damage as normal.

Name: Demilich Mastermind
Languages: Understands The Languages It Knew In Life But Doesnít Speak

Traits.Name: Avoidance
Traits.Content: If the demilich makes a saving throw against an effect that deals half damage on a success, it takes no damage on a success and half damage on a failure.

Traits.Content: If the demilich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, one of the five tiny warding gems set on its forehead or teeth shatters.

If the target fails its saving throw and there is at least one unoccupied soul gem on the demilich's skull, the demilich regains 40 hit points, and the target dies instantly. Its soul is trapped in a soul gem on the demilich's skull, visible as a tiny, creature-shaped mote of light. While its soul is trapped, a creature can't be restored to life by any means. A soul that remains in a soul gem for 30 days is destroyed forever. If the demilich is defeated and a soul gem crushed, the creature is restored to life if its body is within 100 miles. A creature that succeeds on a saving throw against this effect is immune to it for 24 hours.

Actions.Name: A demilich mastermind begins combat with up to four empty soul gems

Reactions.Content: The demilich mastermind has the following additional reactions, which it can use only while bloodied:

Reactions.Name: Reflection Arcane
Reactions.Content: When the demilich succeeds on a saving throw against a spell targeting it, it forces the spell to also target another creature within 30 feet.

Reactions.Name: Skull Shock
Reactions.Content: When the demilich takes damage from a melee attack, the attacker takes 42 (12d6) lightning damage.

LegendaryActions.Name: The demilich can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below
LegendaryActions.Content: Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The demilich regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

LegendaryActions.Name: Cranial Transposition
LegendaryActions.Content: The dust surrounding the demilich falls to the ground. The demilich and a nonmagical, unattended skull within 30 teleport, switching places. Until the demilich moves or attacks, it is indistinguishable from a nonmagical skull, and the dust composing the demilich's wraithlike body doesn't reform around it.

LegendaryActions.Name: Dust Storm (Costs 2 Actions)
LegendaryActions.Content: The dust of the demilich's body swirls in a 30-foot radius around the demilich. Each creature in the area makes a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 21 (6d6) necrotic damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. The demilich then moves up to its speed.

LegendaryActions.Name: Ringing Laugh (Costs 2 Actions)
LegendaryActions.Content: Each creature within 60 feet that can hear the demilich makes a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature is frightened until the end of its next turn.

LegendaryActions.Name: Telekinesis
LegendaryActions.Content: The demilich targets a Huge or smaller creature or an object weighing up to 1,000 pounds within 60 feet. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw. Otherwise, the demilich moves the target up to 30 feet in any direction, including up. If another creature or object stops the target's movement, both take 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage. At the end of this movement, the target falls if it is still in the air, taking falling damage as normal.

Name: Deva

Traits.Name: Magic Resistance
Traits.Content: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

Traits.Name: Aligned
Traits.Content: †An angel radiates a Lawful aura. Most angels also radiate a Good aura, and a few radiate Evil.

Traits.Name: Celestial Dissolution
Traits.Content: †When an angel dies, its body and equipment dissolve into motes of light.

Traits.Name: Detect Alignment
Traits.Content: †An angel knows the alignment, if any, of each creature within 30 feet that it can see.†

Traits.Name: Immortal Nature
Traits.Content: †An angel doesn't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The deva makes two attacks.

Actions.Name: Celestial Hammer (Deva Form Only)
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:**  8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (5d6) radiant damage. On a hit, the target can't make opportunity attacks against the deva until the beginning of the target's next turn.

Actions.Name: Divine Blast
Actions.Content: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (5d8) radiant damage.

Actions.Name: Radiant Energy (1/Day)
Actions.Content: The deva touches a creature other than itself. If the target is unwilling, the deva makes an attack roll with a +8 bonus. The deva can choose to magically heal 60 hit points of damage and end any blindness, curse, deafness, disease, or poison on the target. Alternatively, the deva can choose to deal 60 radiant damage to the target.

Actions.Name: Change Form
Actions.Content: The deva magically transforms into a beast or humanoid or back into its true form. It retains its deva statistics, including speech and telepathy, except that it has the size, movement modes, and traits of its new form.

Combat: Against an isolated foe, the deva flies by the target, using Celestial Hammer and escaping out of range. Against a foe with an inferior ranged attack, it uses Divine Blast from a distance. In other circumstances, it closes to melee range and uses Radiant Energy and Celestial Hammer. Angels have no fear and rarely retreat.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The diplodocus makes a stomp attack and a tail attack against two different targets.†

Actions.Name: Stomp
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

Actions.Name: Tail
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is pushed 10 feet away from the diplodocus and knocked prone.

Traits.Name: Spider Climb
Traits.Content: The centipede can climb even on difficult surfaces and upside down on ceilings.†

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage and the target makes a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 10 (3d6) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. The target is paralyzed while poisoned in this way. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The tyrannosaurus makes a bite attack and a tail attack against two different targets.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the tyrannosaurus can't bite a different creature and it has advantage on bite attacks against the grappled creature.

Actions.Name: Tail
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

BonusActions.Content: The dire tyrannosaurus rex has the following additional bonus actions, which it can use only while bloodied:

BonusActions.Name: Elite Recovery
BonusActions.Content: The dire tyrannosaurus rex ends one negative effect currently affecting it. It can use this bonus action as long as it has at least 1 hit point, even while unconscious or incapacitated.

BonusActions.Name: Trample
BonusActions.Content: The dire tyrannosaurus rex moves up to its speed in a straight line. It can move through the spaces of Large and smaller creatures. Each of these creatures makes a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage and falling prone on a failure.

BonusActions.Name: Tail Sweep
BonusActions.Content: The dire tyrannosaurus rex makes a tail attack against each creature within 10 feet. A creature hit by an attack makes a DC 17 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure.

BonusActions.Name: Roar (1/Day)
BonusActions.Content: Each creature of the dire tyrannosaurus rex's choice within 120 feet that hears its roar makes a DC 14 Charisma saving throw. On a failure, a creature is frightened for 1 minute. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.†

Traits.Name: Keen Hearing and Smell
Traits.Content: The wolf has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing and smell.

Traits.Name: Pack Tactics
Traits.Content: The wolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4+3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it makes a DC 13 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure.

Traits.Name: Keen Smell
Traits.Content: The rat has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

Traits.Name: Pack Tactics
Traits.Content: The giant rat has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the rat's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2) piercing damage. Giant rats who dwell in sewers and filth can carry debilitating disease. A creature bitten by a diseased giant rat makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or it becomes infected with sewer plague.

Traits.Name: Earth Glide
Traits.Content: The divi can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone without disturbing it.

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The divi's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: alter self (can assume Medium or Large form), detect magic, stone shape
3/day each: creation, move earth, passwall, tongues
1/day each: conjure elemental (earth elemental only), plane shift (to Elemental Plane of Earth only)

Traits.Name: Siege Monster
Traits.Content: The divi deals double damage to objects and structures.

Traits.Name: Elemental Demise
Traits.Content: When a genie dies, its body becomes a mote of elemental energy. This mote might take the form of a glowing chunk of earth, a shard of crystallized air, or an ever-burning ember.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The divi makes two melee attacks.

Actions.Name: Crushing Hand
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the divi can't use Crushing Hand on another target and has advantage on Crushing Hand attacks against this target, and the target can't breathe.

Actions.Name: Stone Club
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

Actions.Name: Quake (Recharge 5-6)
Actions.Content: Amid deafening rumbling, the ground shakes in a 10-foot radius around a point on an earth or stone surface within 90 feet. The area becomes difficult terrain. Each non-elemental creature in the area makes a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) thunder damage and falling prone on a failure or taking half damage on a success.†

BonusActions.Name: Stone Wall (1/Day)
BonusActions.Content: A permanent stone wall magically rises from an earth or stone surface within 60 feet. The wall is 6 inches thick and can be up to 20 feet high and 30 feet long. If it appears in a creature's space, the creature can choose which side of the wall to move to. Each 10-foot-by-10-foot section of the wall is an object with AC 18 and 30 hit points.

Traits.Name: Earth Glide
Traits.Content: The divi can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone without disturbing it.

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The divi's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: alter self (can assume Medium or Large form), detect magic, stone shape
3/day each: creation, move earth, passwall, tongues

Traits.Name: Siege Monster
Traits.Content: The divi deals double damage to objects and structures.

Traits.Name: Elemental Demise
Traits.Content: When a genie dies, its body becomes a mote of elemental energy. This mote might take the form of a glowing chunk of earth, a shard of crystallized air, or an ever-burning ember.

Traits.Name: Elite Recovery
Traits.Content: At the end of each of its turns while bloodied, the divi noble ends one negative effect currently affecting it. It can do so as long as it has at least 1 hit point, even while unconscious or incapacitated.

Traits.Name: Magic Resistance
Traits.Content: While bloodied, the divi noble has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

Traits.Name: Wish
Traits.Content: Three times per year, the divi noble can cast wish for a mortal, using no material components.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The divi makes two melee attacks.

Actions.Name: Crushing Hand
