Actions.Content: One creature within 30 feet of the jackalwere makes a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is magically charmed. At the beginning of the jackalwere's next turn, the target repeats the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature falls unconscious for 10 minutes. Both the charmed and unconscious conditions end if the target takes damage or a creature within reach of the target uses an action to shake the target back to its senses. If the target successfully saves against Sleep Gaze, it is immune to Sleep Gaze for 24 hours. Undead and creatures immune to charm aren't affected by it.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The jackalwere makes two scimitar attacks or makes one scimitar attack and uses Sleep Gaze.

BonusActions.Name: Shapeshift
BonusActions.Content: The jackalwere magically changes its form, along with its equipment, to that of a specific Medium humanoid or a jackal-human hybrid or its true form, which is a Small jackal. While shapeshifted, its statistics are otherwise unchanged. It reverts to its true form if it dies.†

BonusActions.Name: Combat The jackalwere shifts to hybrid form and uses Sleep Gaze on an unsuspecting target
BonusActions.Content: It then fights with its scimitar, staying next to at least one ally. A jackalwere is fearless when facing enemies armed with mundane weapons, but it retreats if it is outnumbered by enemies capable of bypassing its resistances.

Actions.Name: Strangle
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature that is surprised, grappled by the kech, or that can't see the kech. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target is pulled 5 feet towards the kech and grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the kech automatically hits with the Strangle attack and the target can't breathe.

Actions.Name: Claw
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage.

Actions.Name: Stealthy Sneak
Actions.Content: The kech moves up to half its Speed without provoking opportunity attacks. It can then attempt to hide.

Traits.Name: Detect Alignment
Traits.Content: The khalkos can detect the presence of creatures within 30 feet that have an alignment trait, and knows the alignment of such creatures.†

Traits.Name: Magic Resistance
Traits.Content: The khalkos has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

Traits.Name: Psionic Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The khalkos's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
1/day each: alter self, plane shift (self only), telekinesis, teleportation circle

Actions.Name: Claw
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

Actions.Name: Chaos Pheromones
Actions.Content: The khalkos emits a cloud of pheromones in a 20-foot radius. The cloud spreads around corners. Each non-khalkos creature in the area makes a DC 14 Intelligence saving throw. Creatures with an alignment trait make this save with disadvantage. On a failure, the creature is confused for 1 minute. It repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the creature makes its saving throw or the condition ends for it, it is immune to Chaos Pheromones for the next 24 hours.†

Actions.Name: Psionic Sting
Actions.Content: The khalkos targets a creature within 30 feet, forcing it to make a DC 16 Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 28 (8d6) psychic damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn.†

BonusActions.Name: Brain Jab
BonusActions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated creature with a brain and an Intelligence of 6 or higher. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target becomes diseased with brain larvae. Once the khalkos has used this attack successfully, it can't use it again for 24 hours.

Reactions.Name: Telekinetic Shield
Reactions.Content: When the khalkos is hit by an attack made by a creature that it can see or sense with its Detect Alignment trait, it gains a +4 bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Traits.Name: Detect Alignment
Traits.Content: The khalkos can detect the presence of creatures within 30 feet that have an alignment trait, and knows the alignment of such creatures.†

Actions.Name: Chaos Pheromones
Actions.Content: The khalkos emits a cloud of pheromones into the air in a 10-foot radius. The cloud spreads around corners. Each non-khalkos creature in the area makes a DC 12 Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, the creature is confused for 1 minute. It repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the creature makes its saving throw or the condition ends for it, it is immune to the chaos pheromones of khalkos spawn for the next 24 hours.†

Actions.Name: Sting
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.†

Traits.Name: Echolocation
Traits.Content: The whale can't use blindsight while deafened.

Traits.Name: Hold Breath
Traits.Content: The whale can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

Traits.Name: Keen Hearing
Traits.Content: The whale has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6+4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the whale can't bite another target and it has advantage on bite attacks against the creature it is grappling.

Traits.Name: Divine Grace
Traits.Content: If the empyrean makes a saving throw against an effect that deals half damage on a success, it takes no damage on a success and half damage on a failure. Furthermore, while wearing medium armor, the empyrean adds its full Dexterity bonus to its Armor Class (already included).

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The empyrean's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 23). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: charm person, command, telekinesis
3/day: flame strike, hold monster, lightning bolt
1/day: commune, greater restoration, heroes' feast, plane shift (self only, can't travel to or from the Material Plane)

Traits.Name: Magic Resistance
Traits.Content: The empyrean has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.†

Traits.Name: Regeneration
Traits.Content: The empyrean regains 10 hit points at the beginning of its turn as long as it has at least 1 hit point.

Traits.Name: Immortal Nature
Traits.Content: A titan doesn't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

Traits.Name: Expanded Spell List
Traits.Content: King Fomor can cast arcane eye and scrying at will, requiring no material components.

Traits.Name: Eye Vulnerability
Traits.Content: A creature can target King Fomor's eye with an attack. This attack is made with disadvantage. If the attack hits and deals at least 20 damage, the fire in King Fomor's eye is extinguished until the end of his next turn. While the fire is extinguished, King Fomor can't use his Burning Gaze attack.

Actions.Name: Maul
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 38 (8d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) radiant damage, and the target makes a DC 25 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is pushed up to 30 feet away and knocked prone.

Actions.Name: Lightning Bolt (3rd-Level; V, S)
Actions.Content: A bolt of lightning 5 feet wide and 100 feet long arcs from the empyrean. Each creature in the area makes a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage on a failure or half damage on a success.

Actions.Name: Flame Strike (5th-Level; V, S)
Actions.Content: A column of divine flame fills a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder within 60 feet. Creatures in the area make a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage and 14 (4d6) radiant damage on a failure or half damage on a success.

Actions.Name: Hold Monster (5th-Level; V, S, Concentration)
Actions.Content: One creature the empyrean can see within 60 feet makes a DC 23 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is paralyzed for 1 minute. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.†

BonusActions.Name: Immortal Form
BonusActions.Content: The empyrean magically changes its size between Gargantuan and Medium. While Medium, the empyrean has disadvantage on Strength checks. Its statistics are otherwise unchanged.

BonusActions.Name: Burning Gaze
BonusActions.Content: A line of fire 5 feet wide and 60 feet long blasts from King Fomor's eye. Each creature in the area makes a DC 23 Constitution saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) fire damage and 35 (10d6) radiant damage on a failure or half damage on a success. When King Fomor is bloodied, his Burning Gaze's shape is a 60-foot cone instead of a line.

BonusActions.Name: Elite Recovery (While Bloodied)
BonusActions.Content: King Fomor ends one negative effect currently affecting him. He can do so as long as he has at least 1 hit point, even while unconscious or incapacitated.

LegendaryActions.Name: The empyrean can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below
LegendaryActions.Content: Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. It regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

LegendaryActions.Name: Attack
LegendaryActions.Content: The empyrean makes a weapon attack.

LegendaryActions.Name: Cast Spell
LegendaryActions.Content: The empyrean casts a spell. The empyrean can't use this option if it has cast a spell since the start of its last turn.

LegendaryActions.Name: Fly
LegendaryActions.Content: The empyrean flies up to half its fly speed.

LegendaryActions.Name: Shout (Recharge 5ñ6)
LegendaryActions.Content: Each creature within 120 feet that can hear the empyrean makes a DC 25 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 24 (7d6) thunder damage and is stunned until the end of the empyrean's next turn. On a success, a creature takes half damage.

Traits.Name: Brave
Traits.Content: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The knight attacks twice with their greatsword.

Actions.Name: Greatsword
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

Actions.Name: Lance (Mounted Only)
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage. If the knight moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack, they deal an extra 6 (1d12) piercing damage, and the target makes a DC 13 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure. This attack is made at disadvantage against targets within 5 feet.

Actions.Name: Heavy Crossbow
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Knightly Inspiration (1/Day)
Actions.Content: The knight inspires creatures of their choice within 30 feet that can hear and understand them. For the next minute, inspired creatures gain an expertise die (1d4) on attack rolls and saving throws. A creature can benefit from only one Knightly Inspiration at a time, and the knight cannot target themselves.

Actions.Name: The typical knight is a highly-trained, heavily-armored cavalry soldier who has sworn allegiance to a noble, monarch, or faith
Actions.Content: Not every knight, however, is forged from the same iron. Some knights fight on foot or on griffon-back, and some owe allegiance to none but themselves.

Traits.Name: Magic Resistance
Traits.Content: The knight captain has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

Traits.Name: Superior Heavy Armor Master
Traits.Content: While wearing heavy armor, the knight captain reduces bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage they take from nonmagical weapons by 5.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The knight captain attacks four times.

Actions.Name: Longsword
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d8 + 7) slashing damage.

Actions.Name: Composite Longbow
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Command the Attack (1/Day)
Actions.Content: The knight captain issues a command to all nonhostile creatures within 30 feet. Creatures who can see or hear the knight captain can use their reaction to make a single weapon attack with advantage.

Actions.Name: Knightly Inspiration (1/Day)
Actions.Content: The knight captain inspires creatures of their choice within 30 feet that can hear and understand them. For the next minute, inspired creatures gain an expertise die (1d4) on attack rolls and saving throws. A creature can benefit from only one Knightly Inspiration at a time, and the knight captain cannot target themselves.

Actions.Name: Knight captains are battle-hardened warriors with countless victories to their names
Actions.Content: Their mere presence inspires even the most novice warrior, and their peerless swordplay can turn the tide of any battle.

Traits.Name: Pack Tactics
Traits.Content: The kobold has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

Traits.Name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Traits.Content: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Perception checks that rely on sight.

Actions.Name: Shiv
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d3 + 2) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Sling
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

Traits.Name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Traits.Content: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Perception checks that rely on sight.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The kobold makes a bill hook attack and a spiked shield attack.

Actions.Name: Bill Hook
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it makes a DC 12 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure.

Actions.Name: Spiked Shield
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Sling
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

Reactions.Name: Rally! (1/Day, While Bloodied)
Reactions.Content: When the kobold takes damage, it shouts a rallying cry. All kobolds within 30 feet that can hear it gain immunity to the frightened condition for 1 minute, and their next attack roll made before this effect ends deals an extra 1d4 damage.

Traits.Name: Pack Tactics
Traits.Content: The kobold has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

Traits.Name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Traits.Content: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Perception checks that rely on sight.

Traits.Name: Dragon's Blood
Traits.Content: The kobold gains resistance to the damage type of its master's breath weapon.

Traits.Name: Ominous Shadow
Traits.Content: The kobold loses its Sunlight Sensitivity trait while within 60 feet of its master.

Traits.Name: Draconic Smite
Traits.Content: If the broodguard has advantage on a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 1d4 damage. This bonus damage is the same type as its master's breath weapon.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The kobold makes a bill hook attack and a spiked shield attack.

Actions.Name: Bill Hook
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it makes a DC 12 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure.

Actions.Name: Spiked Shield
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

Reactions.Content: When the kobold takes damage, it shouts a rallying cry. All kobolds within 30 feet that can hear it gain immunity to the frightened condition for 1 minute, and their next attack roll made before this effect ends deals an extra 1d4 damage.

Traits.Content: The kobold has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

Traits.Name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Traits.Content: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Perception checks that rely on sight.

Traits.Content: The kobold gains resistance to the damage type of its master's breath weapon.

Traits.Name: Ominous Shadow
Traits.Content: The kobold loses its Sunlight Sensitivity trait while within 60 feet of its master.

Actions.Name: Shiv
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d3 + 2) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Sling
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The kobold's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: mage hand, mending
1/day each: charm person, expeditious retreat, mage armor†

Traits.Name: Pack Tactics
Traits.Content: The kobold has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

Traits.Name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Traits.Content: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Perception checks that rely on sight.

Actions.Name: Multiattack (2/day)
Actions.Content: The kobold sorcerer makes three flame bolt attacks.

Actions.Name: Flame Bolt
Actions.Content: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) fire damage.

Actions.Name: Shiv
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

BonusActions.Name: Expeditious Retreat (1st-Level; V, S, Concentration)
BonusActions.Content: When casting this spell and as a bonus action on subsequent turns for 10 minutes, the kobold sorcerer can take the Dash action.

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The kobold's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: mage hand, mending
1/day each: charm person, expeditious retreat, mage armor†

Traits.Name: Pack Tactics
Traits.Content: The kobold has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

Traits.Name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Traits.Content: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Perception checks that rely on sight.

Traits.Name: Dragon's Blood
Traits.Content: The kobold gains resistance to the damage type of its master's breath weapon.

Traits.Name: Ominous Shadow
Traits.Content: The kobold loses its Sunlight Sensitivity trait while within 60 feet of its master.

Actions.Name: Multiattack (2/day)
Actions.Content: The kobold sorcerer makes three flame bolt attacks.

Actions.Name: Flame Bolt
Actions.Content: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10+2) fire damage. The damage type of the sorcerer's flame bolt attack changes to match the damage type of its master's breath weapon.

Actions.Name: Shiv
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

BonusActions.Name: Expeditious Retreat (1st-Level; V, S, Concentration)
BonusActions.Content: When casting this spell and as a bonus action on subsequent turns for 10 minutes, the kobold sorcerer can take the Dash action.

Traits.Name: Immortal Nature
Traits.Content: The kraken doesn't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

Traits.Name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
Traits.Content: If the kraken fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, it can use its reaction, if available, to attack with its tentacle.

Traits.Name: Magic Resistance
Traits.Content: The kraken has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

Traits.Name: Siege Monster
Traits.Content: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature grappled by the kraken, the target is swallowed. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, its Speed is 0, it has total cover from attacks from outside the kraken, and it takes 42 (12d6) acid damage at the start of each of the kraken's turns.

Actions.Name: If a swallowed creature deals 50 or more damage to the kraken in a single turn, or if the kraken dies, the kraken vomits up the creature
Ink Cloud
Actions.Content: While underwater, the kraken exudes a cloud of ink in a 90-foot-radius sphere. The ink extends around corners, and the area is heavily obscured until the end of the kraken's next turn or until a strong current dissipates the cloud. Each non-kraken creature in the area when the cloud appears makes a DC 24 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes 27 (5d10) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. On a success, it takes half damage. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. ending the effect on a success.†

Actions.Name: Summon Storm (1/Day)
Actions.Content: Over the next 10 minutes, storm clouds magically gather. At the end of 10 minutes, a storm rages for 1 hour in a 5-mile radius.

Actions.Name: Lightning (Recharge 5-6)
Actions.Content: If the kraken is outside and the weather is stormy, three lightning bolts crack down from the sky, each of which strikes a different target within 120 feet of the kraken. A target makes a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage or half damage on a save.

Actions.Name: Tentacle
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 26). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. A tentacle can be targeted individually by an attack. It shares the kraken's hit points, but if 30 damage is dealt to the tentacle, it releases a creature it is grappling. The kraken can grapple up to 10 creatures.

Actions.Name: Fling
Actions.Content: One Large or smaller object or creature grappled by the kraken is thrown up to 60 feet in a straight line. The target lands prone and takes 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage. If the kraken throws the target at another creature, that creature makes a DC 26 saving throw, taking the same damage on a failure.

LegendaryActions.Name: The kraken can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below
LegendaryActions.Content: Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. It regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

LegendaryActions.Name: Tentacle
LegendaryActions.Content: The kraken makes one tentacle attack.

LegendaryActions.Name: Fling
LegendaryActions.Content: The kraken uses Fling.

LegendaryActions.Name: Squeeze (Costs 2 Actions)
LegendaryActions.Content: The kraken ends any magical effect that is restraining it or reducing its movement and then swims up to half its swim speed without provoking opportunity attacks. During this movement, it can fit through gaps as narrow as 10 feet wide without squeezing.

Traits.Name: Radiant Sensitivity
Traits.Content: When the ghoul takes radiant damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Perception checks that rely on sight until the end of its next turn.

Traits.Name: Undead Nature
Traits.Content: Ghouls and ghasts don't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

Actions.Name: Paralyzing Claw
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage. If the target is a living creature other than an elf, it makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is paralyzed for 1 minute. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to any Paralyzing Claw for 24 hours.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated creature. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

Traits.Name: Chaotic Evil
Traits.Content: The lamia radiates a Chaotic and Evil aura.†

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The lamia's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.
At will: charm person, disguise self (humanoid form), major image, misty step
1/day each: geas, hallucinatory terrain, hypnotic pattern, scrying

Actions.Name: Dizzying Touch
Actions.Content: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is magically charmed for 1 hour or until it takes damage. While charmed in this way, it has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and ability checks.

Actions.Name: Claws
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) slashing damage.

Actions.Name: Dagger
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target makes a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 10 (3d6) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 hour.

Actions.Name: Hypnotic Pattern (3rd-Level; S, Concentration)
Actions.Content: A swirling pattern of light appears at a point within 120 feet. Each creature within 10 feet of the pattern that can see it makes a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is charmed for 1 minute. While charmed, the creature is incapacitated and its Speed is 0. The effect ends on a creature if it takes damage or if another creature uses an action to shake it out of its daze.

BonusActions.Name: Misty Step (2nd-Level; V)
BonusActions.Content: The lamia teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet. The lamia can't cast this spell and a 1st-level or higher spell on the same turn.

Traits.Name: Devil's Sight
Traits.Content: The lemure's darkvision penetrates magical darkness.

Traits.Name: Eerie Groan
Traits.Content: While the lemure can see a non-devil within 100 feet, it emits a groan that is audible within 300 feet.†

Traits.Name: Lawful Evil
Traits.Content: The lemure radiates a Lawful and Evil aura.†

Actions.Name: Fist
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

Traits.Name: Area Vulnerability
Traits.Content: The band takes double damage from any effect that targets an area.

Traits.Name: Band Dispersal
Traits.Content: When the band is reduced to 0 hit points, it turns into 2 (1d4) lemures with 6 hit points each.

Traits.Name: Band
Traits.Content: The band is composed of 5 or more lemures. If it is subjected to a spell, attack, or other effect that affects only one target, it takes any damage but ignores other effects. It can share its space with Medium or smaller creatures or objects. The band can move through any opening large enough for one Medium creature without squeezing.†††††

Traits.Name: Devil's Sight
Traits.Content: The band's darkvision penetrates magical darkness.

Traits.Name: Eerie Groan
Traits.Content: While the band can see a non-devil within 100 feet, it emits a groan that is audible within 300 feet.†

Traits.Name: Lawful Evil
Traits.Content: The band radiates a Lawful and Evil aura.

Actions.Name: Fists
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (5d4) bludgeoning damage.

Traits.Name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
Traits.Content: The lich's body or vestments are warded with three protective runes. When the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, one of its protective runes disappears.

Traits.Name: Rejuvenation
Traits.Content: If it has a soul vessel, a destroyed lich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its hit points. The new body forms within 10 feet of the soul vessel.

Traits.Name: Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The lich is a 16th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). The lich has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, mage hand, prestidigitation
1st-level (4 slots): detect magic, shield, silent image, thunderwave
2nd-level (3 slots): blur, detect thoughts, locate object
3rd-level (3 slots): animate dead, dispel magic, fireball
4th-level (3 slots): confusion, dimension door
5th-level (2 slots): geas, scrying
6th-level (1 slot): create undead, disintegrate
7th-level (1 slot): finger of death, teleport
8th-level (1 slot): power word stun

Traits.Name: Tongueless Utterance
Traits.Content: Unless a spell has only a vocal component, the lich can cast the spell without providing a vocal component.

Traits.Name: Turn Resistance
Traits.Content: The lich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

Traits.Name: Undead Nature
Traits.Content: A lich doesn't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

Actions.Name: Paralyzing Touch
Actions.Content: Melee Spell Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (4d6 + 5) cold damage. The target makes a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

Actions.Name: Arc Lightning
Actions.Content: The lich targets up to 3 creatures within 60 feet. Each target makes a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 28 (8d6) lightning damage.

Actions.Name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip; S)
Actions.Content: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d10) fire damage.

Actions.Name: Thunderwave (1st-Level; S)
Actions.Content: Thunder rolls from the lich in a 15-foot cube. Each creature in the area makes a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 9 (2d8) thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet from the lich. On a success, a creature takes half damage and is not pushed.†

Actions.Name: Blur (2nd-Level; V, Concentration)
Actions.Content: The lich's form is blurred. Attack rolls against it are made with disadvantage unless the attacker has senses that allow them to perceive without sight or to see through illusions (like blindsight or truesight).

Actions.Name: Fireball (3rd-Level; S, M)
Actions.Content: Fire streaks from the lich to a point within 120 feet and explodes in a 20-foot radius, spreading around corners. Each creature in the area makes a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

Actions.Name: Confusion (4th-Level; S, M, Concentration)
Actions.Content: Each creature within 10 feet of a point the lich can see within 120 feet makes a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw, becoming rattled until the end of its next turn on a success. On a failure, a creature is confused for 1 minute and can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Actions.Name: Disintegrate (6th-Level; S, M)
Actions.Content: The lich disintegrates a target within 60 feet. A Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, or a 10-foot-cube section thereof, is automatically destroyed. A creature makes a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 75 (10d6 + 40) force damage on a failed save. If reduced to 0 hit points, the creature and its nonmagical gear are disintegrated, and the creature can be restored to life only† with true resurrection or wish.†

Actions.Name: Finger of Death (7th-Level; S)
Actions.Content: A creature within 60 feet makes a DC 20 Constitution saving throw, taking 61 (7d8 + 30) necrotic damage on a failed saving throw or half damage on a success. A humanoid killed by this spell turns into a zombie under the lich's control at the start of the lich's next turn.

Actions.Name: Power Word Stun (8th-Level; V)
Actions.Content: The lich targets a creature within 60 feet. If the target has more than 150 hit points, it is rattled until the end of its next turn. Otherwise, it is stunned. It can make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

BonusActions.Name: Eldritch Aura
BonusActions.Content: The lich surrounds itself with a magical, rune-covered, glowing, translucent aura in a 10-foot radius. The aura moves with the lich and casts dim light inside its area. The aura disappears at the beginning of the lich's next turn.

BonusActions.Name: Death Aura
BonusActions.Content: The aura casts purple light. Each living creature that ends its turn inside the aura takes 17 (5d6) necrotic damage, and the lich regains the same number of hit points.

BonusActions.Name: Shield Aura
BonusActions.Content: The aura casts orange light. It has 35 hit points. Whenever the lich would take damage, the aura takes the damage instead, and the aura visibly weakens. If the damage reduces the aura to 0 hit points, the aura disappears, and the lich takes any excess damage.†

BonusActions.Name: Spell Shield Aura
BonusActions.Content: The aura casts blue light. Any spell cast with a 5th-level or lower spell slot from outside the aura can't affect anything inside the aura. Using a spell to target something inside the aura or include the aura's space in an area has no effect on anything inside.†

Reactions.Name: Sabotage Spell
Reactions.Content: When a creature within 60 feet casts a spell that targets the lich, the lich attempts to interrupt it. The lich makes an Intelligence check against a DC of 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell fails, and the caster takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

Reactions.Name: Shield (1st-Level; V, S)
Reactions.Content: When the lich is hit by an attack or targeted by magic missile, it gains a +5 bonus to AC (including against the triggering attack) and immunity to magic missile. These benefits last until the beginning of its next turn.

LegendaryActions.Name: The lich can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below
LegendaryActions.Content: Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. It regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

LegendaryActions.Name: Cast Spell
LegendaryActions.Content: The lich casts cantrip or a 1st-level spell. The lich can use 2 legendary actions to cast a 2nd-level spell or 3 legendary actions to cast a 3rd-level spell.

LegendaryActions.Name: Paralyzing Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
LegendaryActions.Content: The lich uses Paralyzing Touch.

LegendaryActions.Name: Arc Lightning (Costs 3 Actions)
LegendaryActions.Content: The lich uses Arc Lightning.

Traits.Name: Keen Smell
Traits.Content: The lion has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

Traits.Name: Long Jump
Traits.Content: The lion can long jump up to 25 feet.

Traits.Name: Pack Tactics
Traits.Content: The lion has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the lion's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

Actions.Name: Claws
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) slashing damage. If the lion moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack, the target makes a DC 13 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10+3) piercing damage.

BonusActions.Name: Opportune Bite
BonusActions.Content: The lion makes a bite attack against a prone creature.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage. If this damage would reduce a Small or larger target to 0 hit points, the target takes no damage from this attack.

Traits.Name: Hold Breath
Traits.Content: The lizardfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The lizardfolk attacks with its club and shield.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage if the attack is made with advantage.

Actions.Name: Club
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

Actions.Name: Shield
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

Actions.Name: Javelin
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Traits.Name: Aligned
Traits.Content: The lizardfolk radiates either an Evil or Good aura.†

Traits.Name: Hold Breath
Traits.Content: The lizardfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The lizardfolk attacks once with its shield and twice with its trident.

Actions.Name: Shield
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target makes a DC 13 Strength check. On a failure, it is knocked prone.

Actions.Name: Trident
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the lizardfolk gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt.†

Reactions.Name: Supernatural Rebuke (1/Day)
Reactions.Content: When the lizardfolk is dealt damage by a creature it can see within 60 feet, its attacker makes a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the attacker takes 11 (2d10) fire or radiant damage (the lizardfolk's choice).

Traits.Name: Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The mage is a 9th level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). They have the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation
1st-level (4 slots): detect magic, identify, mage armor, shield
2nd-level (3 slots): alter self, misty step
3rd-level (3 slots): clairvoyance, counterspell, fireball
4th-level (3 slots): dimension door, greater invisibility
5th-level (1 slot): cone of cold

Actions.Name: Dagger
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip; V, S)
Actions.Content: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d10) fire damage.

Actions.Name: Fireball (3rd-Level; V, S, M)
Actions.Content: Fire streaks from the mage to a point within 120 feet and explodes in a 20-foot radius, spreading around corners. Each creature in the area makes a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

Actions.Name: Dimension Door (4th-Level; V)
Actions.Content: The mage teleports to a location within 500 feet. They can bring along one willing Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet. If a creature would teleport to an occupied space, it takes 14 (4d6) force damage, and the spell fails.

Actions.Name: Greater Invisibility (4th-Level; V, S, Concentration)
Actions.Content: The mage or a creature they touch is invisible for 1 minute.

Actions.Name: Cone of Cold (5th-Level; V, S, M)
Actions.Content: Frost blasts from the mage in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in the area makes a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) cold damage on a failure or half damage on a success.†

BonusActions.Name: Misty Step (2nd-Level; V)
BonusActions.Content: The mage teleports to an unoccupied space they can see within 30 feet. The mage can't cast this spell and a 1st-level or higher spell on the same turn.

Reactions.Name: Counterspell (3rd-Level; S)
Reactions.Content: When a creature the mage can see within 60 feet casts a spell, the mage attempts to interrupt it. If the creature is casting a 2nd-level spell or lower, the spell fails. If the creature is casting a 3rd-level or higher spell, the mage makes an Intelligence check against a DC of 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell fails, and the spellcasting creature can use its reaction to try to cast a second spell with the same casting time so long as it uses a spell slot level equal to or less than half the original spell slot. If the mage casts counterspell with a higher spell slot, the interrupted spell fails if its level is less than that of counterspell.

Reactions.Name: Shield (1st-Level; V, S)
Reactions.Content: When the mage is hit by an attack or targeted by magic missile, they gain a +5 bonus to AC (including against the triggering attack) and immunity to magic missile. These benefits last until the start of their next turn.

Traits.Name: Death Burst
Traits.Content: When the mephit dies, it explodes into lava. Each creature within 5 feet makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) fire damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

Traits.Name: False Appearance
Traits.Content: While motionless, the mephit is indistinguishable from a small magma flow.

Traits.Name: Elemental Nature
Traits.Content: A mephit doesn't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

Actions.Name: Claws
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

Actions.Name: Heat Metal (1/Day)
Actions.Content: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature wearing or holding a metal object. Hit: 9 (2d8) fire damage. If a creature is holding the object and suffers damage, it makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, dropping the object on a failure.†

Actions.Name: Fire Breath (1/Day)
Actions.Content: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of fire. Each creature in the area makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) fire damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

Traits.Name: Blazing Blood
Traits.Content: When the magmin takes damage that doesn't kill it, or when it is subjected to fire damage, its magma shell cracks and it is set ablaze. While ablaze, the magmin sheds bright light for 10 feet and dim light for an additional 10 feet. If the magmin is subjected to cold damage while ablaze, this flame is extinguished. The magmin can also set itself ablaze or extinguish itself as an action.

Traits.Name: Death Burst
Traits.Content: If the magmin dies while ablaze, it explodes in a burst of magma. Each creature within 10 feet makes a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) fire damage on a failed save. Unattended flammable objects in the area are ignited.

Traits.Name: Elemental Nature
Traits.Content: A magmin doesn't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

Actions.Name: Touch
Actions.Content: †Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) fire damage. If the magmin is ablaze and the target is a creature, it suffers 5 (1d10) ongoing fire damage until a creature takes an action to extinguish the flame on the target.

Actions.Name: Spurt Magma (Ablaze Only)
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) fire damage.

Traits.Name: Cloaked Mind
Traits.Content: When subjected to a divination effect that detects fiends or alignment, the malcubus makes a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a success, the malcubus's nature is not detected.

Traits.Name: Evil
Traits.Content: The malcubus radiates an Evil aura.†

Traits.Name: Telepathic Bond
Traits.Content: The malcubus can communicate telepathically with a charmed creature over any distance, even on a different plane of existence.

Actions.Name: Claw (Malcubus Form Only)
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

Actions.Name: Charm
Actions.Content: The malcubus targets one humanoid on the same plane of existence within 30 feet, forcing it to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is magically charmed for 1 day or until the malcubus charms another creature. The charmed creature obeys the malcubus's commands. The creature repeats the saving throw whenever it takes damage or if it receives a suicidal command. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to any malcubus's Charm for 24 hours.†

Actions.Name: Draining Kiss
Actions.Content: The malcubus kisses a willing or charmed creature. The target makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) psychic damage on a failed save or half damage on a success. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by the same amount until it finishes a long rest, and the malcubus regains hit points equal to the same amount. If the target is charmed by the malcubus, the charm ends.

Actions.Name: Etherealness
Actions.Content: The malcubus magically travels to the Ethereal Plane. While on the Ethereal Plane, the malcubus can see and hear into the Material Plane and can choose to make itself audible and hazily visible to creatures on the Material Plane. If a humanoid on the Material Plane invites the malcubus to do so, the malcubus can use an action to magically travel from the Ethereal Plane to the Material Plane.††

Actions.Name: Dream (1/Day)
Actions.Content: While on the Ethereal Plane, the malcubus magically touches a sleeping humanoid that is not protected by a magic circle or protection from evil and good spell or similar magic. While the touch persists, the malcubus appears in the creature's dreams. The creature can end the dream at any time. If the dream lasts for 1 hour, the target gains no benefit from the rest, and the malcubus can use Charm on the creature even if it's on a different plane of existence.†

BonusActions.Name: Shapeshift
BonusActions.Content: The malcubus magically changes its form to a Medium or Small humanoid or into its true form. It can fly only in its true form. While shapeshifted, its statistics are unchanged except for its size and speed. Its equipment is not transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.†

Reactions.Name: Living Shield
Reactions.Content: When a creature the malcubus can see hits it with an attack, the malcubus can give an order to a creature charmed by it within 5 feet. The charmed creature uses its reaction, if available, to swap places with the malcubus. The attack hits the charmed creature instead of the malcubus.

Actions.Name: Gore
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d10+7) piercing damage. If the elephant moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack, the target makes a DC 18 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure.

Actions.Name: Stomp
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d10+7) bludgeoning damage.

BonusActions.Name: Trample
BonusActions.Content: The mammoth makes a stomp attack against a prone creature.

BonusActions.Name: Trunk Fling
BonusActions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d6+7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is pushed 10 feet away from the mammoth and knocked prone.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The manticore attacks with its bite and its claws.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Claws
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage. If the manticore moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack, the target makes a DC 13 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure.

Actions.Name: Tail
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Tail Spike Volley (4/Day)
Actions.Content: The manticore fires tail spikes in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line. Each creature in the area makes a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) piercing damage on a failure or half damage on a success.

Reactions.Name: Tail Whip
Reactions.Content: If a creature the manticore can see hits it with a melee attack, the manticore attacks the attacker with its tail. If it hits, it can fly up to half its fly speed without provoking opportunity attacks from the attacker.

Traits.Name: Amphibious
Traits.Content: The marid can breathe air and water.

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The marid's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: alter self (can assume Medium or Large form), create or destroy water, detect magic, purify food and drink
3/day each: control water, creation, tongues, water breathing, water walk
1/day each: conjure elemental (water elemental only), plane shift (to Elemental Plane of Water only)

Traits.Name: Elemental Demise
Traits.Content: When a genie dies, its body becomes a mote of elemental energy. This mote might take the form of a glowing chunk of earth, a shard of crystallized air, or an ever-burning ember.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The marid makes two trident attacks. One of these can be replaced with a net attack.

Actions.Name: Trident
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) lightning damage. If thrown, the trident returns to the marid's hand.

Actions.Name: Net
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 5/15 ft., one target. Hit: A Large, Medium, or Small target is restrained until it is freed. A creature can use its action to make a DC 18 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The net is an object with AC 10, 20 hit points, vulnerability to slashing damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage.

BonusActions.Name: Fog Cloud (1/Day)
BonusActions.Content: The marid magically creates a heavily obscured area of fog (or, if underwater, inky water) in a 30-foot radius around a point it can see within 60 feet. The fog spreads around corners and can be dispersed by a moderate wind or current (at least 10 miles per hour). Otherwise, it disperses after 10 minutes. The marid can see through this fog.

BonusActions.Name: Water Jet (While Bloodied)
BonusActions.Content: The marid shoots water in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long jet. Each creature in the area makes a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage and is pushed 20 feet away from the marid, to a maximum of 60 feet away, and knocked prone. On a success, a target takes half damage.

Traits.Name: Amphibious
Traits.Content: The marid can breathe air and water.

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The marid's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: alter self (can assume Medium or Large form), create or destroy water, detect magic, purify food and drink
3/day each: control water, creation, tongues, water breathing, water walk
1/day each: conjure elemental (water elemental only), plane shift (to Elemental Plane of Water only)

Traits.Name: Elemental Demise
Traits.Content: When a genie dies, its body becomes a mote of elemental energy. This mote might take the form of a glowing chunk of earth, a shard of crystallized air, or an ever-burning ember.

Traits.Name: Elite Recovery
Traits.Content: At the end of each of its turns while bloodied, the marid noble ends one negative effect currently affecting it. It can do so as long as it has at least 1 hit point, even while unconscious or incapacitated.

Traits.Name: Magic Resistance
Traits.Content: While bloodied, the marid noble has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

Traits.Name: Reactive
Traits.Content: The marid may take a reaction on each creature's turn.

Traits.Name: Wish
Traits.Content: Three times per year, the marid can cast wish for a mortal, using no material components.†

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The marid makes two trident attacks. One of these can be replaced with a net attack.

Actions.Name: Trident
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) lightning damage. If thrown, the trident returns to the marid's hand.

Actions.Name: Net
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 5/15 ft., one target. Hit: A Large, Medium, or Small target is restrained until it is freed. A creature can use its action to make a DC 18 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. The net is an object with AC 10, 20 hit points, vulnerability to slashing damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage.

BonusActions.Name: Fog Cloud (1/Day)
BonusActions.Content: The marid magically creates a heavily obscured area of fog (or, if underwater, inky water) in a 30-foot radius around a point it can see within 60 feet. The fog spreads around corners and can be dispersed by a moderate wind or current (at least 10 miles per hour). Otherwise, it disperses after 10 minutes. The marid can see through this fog.

BonusActions.Name: Water Jet (While Bloodied)
BonusActions.Content: The marid shoots water in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long jet. Each creature in the area makes a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage and is pushed 20 feet away from the marid, to a maximum of 60 feet away, and knocked prone. On a success, a target takes half damage.

Reactions.Content: The marid noble has the following additional reaction, which it can use only while bloodied:

Reactions.Name: Water Jet
Reactions.Content: When the marid takes damage, it uses Water Jet if it can include the attacker in the area.

Traits.Name: Chaotic Evil
Traits.Content: The marilith radiates a Chaotic and Evil aura.†

Traits.Name: Magic Resistance
Traits.Content: The marilith has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The marilith makes six attacks with its longswords.

Actions.Name: Longsword
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

BonusActions.Name: Tail
BonusActions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 19).

BonusActions.Name: Teleport
BonusActions.Content: The marilith magically teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

Reactions.Name: Reactive Teleport
Reactions.Content: When the marilith is hit or missed by a ranged attack, it uses Teleport. If it teleports within 5 feet of a creature, it can attack with its tail.

Traits.Name: Crossbow Expert
Traits.Content: The master assassin ignores the loading quality of light crossbows, and being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on the master assassin's ranged attack rolls.

Traits.Name: Deadly Poison
Traits.Content: As part of making an attack, the master assassin can apply a deadly poison to their weapons (included below). The master assassin carries 3 doses of this poison. A single dose can coat two melee weapons or up to 10 pieces of ammunition.

Traits.Name: Death Strike (1/Turn)
Traits.Content: When the master assassin scores a critical hit against a living creature that is surprised, that creature makes a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is reduced to 0 hit points. The creature dies if it fails two death saves before it stabilizes.

Traits.Name: Epic Assassinate
Traits.Content: During the first turn of combat, the master assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't acted. Any hit the master assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit, and every creature that can see the master assassin's attack is rattled until the end of the master assassin's next turn.

Traits.Name: Evasion
Traits.Content: When the master assassin makes a Dexterity saving throw against an effect that deals half damage on a success, they take no damage on a success and half damage on a failure.

Traits.Name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
Traits.Content: The master assassin deals an extra 28 (8d6) damage when they hit with a weapon attack while they have advantage on the attack, or when the master assassin's target is within 5 feet of an ally of the master assassin while the master assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack.†

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The master assassin attacks twice.

Actions.Name: Shortsword
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage. The target makes a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) poison damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

Actions.Name: Light Crossbow
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage. The target makes a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) poison damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

BonusActions.Name: Cunning Action
BonusActions.Content: The assassin takes the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

BonusActions.Name: Rapid Attack
BonusActions.Content: The assassin attacks with their shortsword.

BonusActions.Name: Master assassins always get their mark
BonusActions.Content: These killers never play fair, and aim to kill before they are ever seen. They have far more money and resources than the average contract killer, allowing them access to rare, potent poisons.

Traits.Name: Crossbow Expert
Traits.Content: The master assassin ignores the loading quality of light crossbows, and being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on the master assassin's ranged attack rolls.

Traits.Name: Deadly Poison
Traits.Content: As part of making an attack, the master thief can apply a deadly poison to their weapons (included below). The master thief carries 3 doses of this poison. A single dose can coat two melee weapons or up to 10 pieces of ammunition. †A creature reduced to 0 hit points by their poison damage is stable but unconscious for 1 hour

Traits.Name: Evasion
Traits.Content: When the master assassin makes a Dexterity saving throw against an effect that deals half damage on a success, they take no damage on a success and half damage on a failure.

Traits.Name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
Traits.Content: The master assassin deals an extra 28 (8d6) damage when they hit with a weapon attack while they have advantage on the attack, or when the master assassin's target is within 5 feet of an ally of the master assassin while the master assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack.†

Traits.Name: Cunning Celerity
Traits.Content: The master thief takes two bonus actions on each of their turns.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The master assassin attacks twice.

Actions.Name: Shortsword
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage. The target makes a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) poison damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

Actions.Name: Light Crossbow
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage. The target makes a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) poison damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

BonusActions.Name: Cunning Action
BonusActions.Content: The assassin takes the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

BonusActions.Name: Rapid Attack
BonusActions.Content: The assassin attacks with their shortsword.

BonusActions.Name: Master thieves pride themselves on being able to steal anything, no matter how well-guarded
BonusActions.Content: Many master thieves avoid killing when possible.

Traits.Name: Keen Hearing and Smell
Traits.Content: The mastiff has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing and smell.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4+1) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it makes a DC 11 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure.

Traits.Name: Petrifying Gaze
Traits.Content: When a creature starts its turn within 60 feet of the medusa and can see the medusa's eyes, it can choose to shut its eyes until the beginning of its next turn unless it is surprised or incapacitated. Otherwise, the medusa uses its petrifying gaze on the creature. If the medusa sees its own reflection and doesn't shut its eyes, it is subject to its own gaze.

Traits.Name: A creature subject to the medusa's petrifying gaze makes a DC 14 Constitution saving throw
Traits.Content: If it rolls a natural 1 on the save, it is petrified instantly. If it otherwise fails the save, it is restrained as it begins to be petrified. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success and becoming petrified on a failure. The petrification can be removed with greater restoration or similar powerful magic.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The medusa makes any combination of two attacks with its snake hair and longbow.

Actions.Name: Snake Hair
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage, plus an additional 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the target is a creature that is surprised or that can't see the medusa.

Actions.Name: Longbow
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

Traits.Name: Petrifying Gaze
Traits.Content: When a creature starts its turn within 60 feet of the medusa and can see the medusa's eyes, it can choose to shut its eyes until the beginning of its next turn unless it is surprised or incapacitated. Otherwise, the medusa uses its petrifying gaze on the creature. If the medusa sees its own reflection and doesn't shut its eyes, it is subject to its own gaze.

Traits.Name: A creature subject to the medusa's petrifying gaze makes a DC 14 Constitution saving throw
Traits.Content: If it rolls a natural 1 on the save, it is petrified instantly. If it otherwise fails the save, it is restrained as it begins to be petrified. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success and becoming petrified on a failure. The petrification can be removed with greater restoration or similar powerful magic.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The medusa makes any combination of two attacks with its snake hair and longbow.

Actions.Name: Snake Hair
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage, plus an additional 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the target is a creature that is surprised or that can't see the medusa.

Actions.Name: Longbow
Actions.Content: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

LegendaryActions.Name: The medusa queen has one legendary action it can take at the end of another creature's turn, choosing from the options below
LegendaryActions.Content: The medusa queen regains the spent legendary action at the start of its turn.

LegendaryActions.Name: Hide
LegendaryActions.Content: The medusa moves up to half its Speed and hides.

LegendaryActions.Name: Snake Hair
LegendaryActions.Content: The medusa uses Snake Hair.

LegendaryActions.Name: Frenzy of Snakes (1/Day, When Bloodied)
LegendaryActions.Content: The medusa uses Snake Hair on each creature within 5 feet.†

LegendaryActions.Name: Imperious Command
LegendaryActions.Content: A creature with averted or covered eyes within 60 feet† that can hear the medusa makes a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it looks at the medusa, making itself the target of Petrifying Gaze if it and the medusa can see each other. On a success, the creature is immune to Imperious Command for 24 hours. This is a charm effect.

Traits.Name: Panicked Rage
Traits.Content: While a merclops is frightened and the source of its fear is in sight, it makes attack rolls with advantage instead of disadvantage.

Traits.Name: Poor Depth Perception
Traits.Content: The merclops makes all ranged attacks with disadvantage.

Traits.Name: Aquatic
Traits.Content: The merclops can breathe underwater.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The merclops makes two melee attacks.

Actions.Name: Club
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

Actions.Name: Harpoon
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 90 ft. (see Poor Depth Perception), one target. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 5) piercing damage. The target makes a DC 16 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the merclops pulls the target up to 30 feet toward the merclops.

BonusActions.Name: Thick Skulled (1/Day)
BonusActions.Content: The merclops can end one condition on itself that was imposed through a failed Wisdom saving throw.

Reactions.Name: Big Windup
Reactions.Content: When a creature hits the merclops with a melee attack, the merclops readies a powerful strike against its attacker. The merclops has advantage on the next club attack it makes against the attacker before the end of its next turn.

Traits.Name: Amphibious
Traits.Content: The merfolk can breathe air and water.

Actions.Name: Trident
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if thrown.

Traits.Name: Amphibious
Traits.Content: The knight can breathe air and water.

Traits.Name: Brave
Traits.Content: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The knight makes two trident attacks.

Actions.Name: Trident
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, or 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage if thrown.

Actions.Name: Lance (Mounted Only)
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage. If the knight moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack, it deals an extra 6 (1d12) piercing damage, and the target makes a DC 13 Strength saving throw, falling prone on a failure. This attack is made at disadvantage against targets within 5 feet of the knight.

Actions.Name: Knightly Inspiration (1/Day)
Actions.Content: The knight inspires creatures of its choice within 30 feet that can hear and understand it. For the next minute, inspired creatures gain an expertise die on attack rolls and saving throws. A creature can benefit from only one Knightly Inspiration at a time, and the knight cannot target itself.

BonusActions.Name: Trident
BonusActions.Content: The knight makes a trident attack.

Traits.Name: Amphibious
Traits.Content: The merrow can breathe air and water.

Actions.Name: Claws
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the merrow can't attack a different creature with its claws.

Actions.Name: Harpoon
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. The target makes a DC 14 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the merrow pulls the target up to 20 feet toward the merrow.

BonusActions.Name: Bite
BonusActions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage, or 9 (2d4 + 4) piercing damage if the target is grappled.

Traits.Name: Amphibious
Traits.Content: The merrow can breathe air and water.

Traits.Name: Regeneration
Traits.Content: The merrow regains 10 hit points at the beginning of each of its turns as long as it has at least 1 hit point.

Traits.Name: Innate Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The mage's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: darkness, invisibility
1/day: charm person

Actions.Name: Claws
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the merrow can't attack a different creature with its claws.

Actions.Name: Harpoon
Actions.Content: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. The target makes a DC 14 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the merrow pulls the target up to 20 feet toward the merrow.

BonusActions.Name: Bite
BonusActions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage, or 9 (2d4 + 4) piercing damage if the target is grappled.

BonusActions.Name: Mage Bolt (3/Day)
BonusActions.Content: The mage targets a creature within 30 feet. The target makes a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) lightning damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

BonusActions.Name: Shapeshift
BonusActions.Content: The mage changes its form to that of a Medium merfolk or back into its true form. While shapeshifted, it can't use its Bite attack but its statistics are otherwise unchanged except for its size. It reverts to its true form if it dies.†

BonusActions.Name: Darkness (2nd-Level; V, S, Concentration)
BonusActions.Content: Magical darkness spreads from a point within 60 feet of the mage, filling a 15-foot-radius sphere and spreading around corners. It remains for 1 minute. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

BonusActions.Name: Invisibility (2nd-Level; V, S, Concentration)
BonusActions.Content: The mage is invisible for 1 hour or until it attacks, uses Mage Bolt, or casts a spell.

Traits.Name: False Appearance
Traits.Content: While the mimic is motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate object.

Traits.Name: Sticky
Traits.Content: A creature, object, or weapon that touches the mimic is stuck to the mimic. A creature can use an action to make a DC 14 Strength check, freeing itself or an object or creature within reach on a success. The effect also ends when the mimic chooses to end it or when the mimic dies.

Traits.Name: Telepathic Sense
Traits.Content: A mimic telepathically senses the presence of humanoids within 120 feet and gains a mental image of any inanimate object desired by any of the creatures it senses. This ability is blocked by 3 feet of wood or dirt, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or a thin sheet of lead.

Traits.Name: Water Soluble
Traits.Content: If the mimic is splashed with at least 1 gallon of water, it assumes its true form and the DC to escape its Sticky trait is reduced to 10 until the end of its next turn.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The mimic makes a bite attack and a pseudopod attack.

Actions.Name: Pseudopod
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is subjected to the mimic's Sticky trait.

Actions.Name: Bite
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature stuck to the mimic. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is restrained until it is no longer stuck to the mimic. While a creature is restrained by the mimic, the mimic can't bite a different creature.

Actions.Name: Swallow
Actions.Content: The mimic makes a bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature restrained by it. If the attack hits and the mimic has not swallowed another creature, the target is swallowed and no longer stuck to the mimic. A swallowed creature has total cover from attacks from outside the mimic, is blinded and restrained, and takes 5 (2d4) acid damage at the start of each of the mimic's turns.

Actions.Name: If a swallowed creature deals 10 or more damage to the mimic in a single turn, or if the mimic dies, the target falls prone in an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the mimic and is no longer swallowed

BonusActions.Name: Shapeshift
BonusActions.Content: The mimic changes its form to resemble an inanimate object of its approximate size or changes into its true form, which is an amorphous blob. Objects it is carrying or stuck to are not transformed. While shapeshifted, its statistics are unchanged. It reverts to its true form if it dies.†

Traits.Name: Labyrinthine Recall
Traits.Content: The minotaur can perfectly recall any route it has traveled.

Actions.Name: Greataxe
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage. The minotaur can choose to make the attack with advantage. If it does so, attacks against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

Actions.Name: Gore
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight towards the target before the attack, the attack deals an extra 9 (2d8) damage, and the target makes a DC 16 Strength saving throw, being pushed up to 10 feet away and falling prone on a failure.

BonusActions.Name: Roar of Triumph
BonusActions.Content: If the minotaur reduced a living creature to 0 hit points since the end of its last turn, it roars and gains 10 (3d6) temporary hit points.

Traits.Name: Labyrinthine Recall
Traits.Content: The minotaur can perfectly recall any route it has traveled.

Traits.Name: Magic Resistance
Traits.Content: The minotaur has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The minotaur gores once and attacks twice with its greataxe.†

Actions.Name: Gore
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) piercing damage, and the target makes a DC 19 Strength saving throw, being pushed up to 5 feet away and falling prone on a failure. If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight towards the target before the attack, the attack deals an extra 13 (3d8) damage.

Actions.Name: Greataxe
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) slashing damage.†

Actions.Name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
Actions.Content: The minotaur exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area makes a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 (10d10) fire damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.†

BonusActions.Name: Roar of Triumph
BonusActions.Content: If the minotaur reduced a living creature to 0 hit points since the end of its last turn, it roars and gains 35 (10d6) temporary hit points.

Traits.Name: Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The minstrel is a 5th level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). They have the following bard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): light, mage hand, minor illusion, vicious mockery
1st-level (4 slots): charm person, disguise self, healing word
2nd-level (3 slots): enthrall, invisibility, shatter
3rd-level (2 slots): hypnotic pattern, major image

Actions.Name: Rapier
Actions.Content: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

Actions.Name: Vicious Mockery (Cantrip; V)
Actions.Content: A creature within 60 feet that can hear the minstrel makes a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage and has disadvantage on the first attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

Actions.Name: Invisibility (2nd-Level; V, S, M, Concentration)
Actions.Content: The minstrel or a creature they touch is invisible for 1 hour. The spell ends if the invisible creature attacks or casts a spell.

Actions.Name: Shatter (2nd-Level; V, S, M)
Actions.Content: An ear-splitting ringing sound fills a 10-foot-radius sphere emanating from a point the minstrel can see within 60 feet. Creatures in the area make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 13 (3d8) thunder damage on a failed save or half damage on a success. A creature made of stone, metal, or other inorganic material has disadvantage on its saving throw. Unattended objects in the area also take the damage.†

Actions.Name: Hypnotic Pattern (3rd-Level; S, M, Concentration)
Actions.Content: A swirling pattern of light appears at a point within 120 feet. Each creature within 10 feet of the pattern that can see it makes a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is charmed for 1 minute. While charmed, the creature is incapacitated and its Speed is 0. The effect ends on a creature if it takes damage or if another creature uses an action to shake it out of its daze.

BonusActions.Name: Martial Encouragement
BonusActions.Content: Until the beginning of the minstrel's next turn, one creature within 30 feet that can hear the minstrel deals an extra 3 (1d6) damage whenever it deals weapon damage.

BonusActions.Name: Healing Word (1st-Level; V)
BonusActions.Content: The minstrel or a living creature within 60 feet regains 5 (1d4 + 3) hit points. The minstrel can't cast this spell and a 1st-level or higher spell on the same turn.

BonusActions.Name: Minstrels are musicians who weave magic into their performances
BonusActions.Content: Minstrels make themselves welcome wherever they go with a mix of entertainment, storytelling, and when necessary, magical charm.

Traits.Name: False Appearance
Traits.Content: While the mimic is motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate object.

Traits.Name: Sticky
Traits.Content: A creature, object, or weapon that touches the mimic is stuck to the mimic. A creature can use an action to make a DC 14 Strength check, freeing itself or an object or creature within reach on a success. The effect also ends when the mimic chooses to end it or when the mimic dies.

Traits.Name: Water Soluble
Traits.Content: If the mimic is splashed with at least 1 gallon of water, it assumes its true form and the DC to escape its Sticky trait is reduced to 10 until the end of its next turn.

Traits.Name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
